results.description:
Please join us at our October General Meeting of the Rockville Centre Tea Party Patriots-  Tuesday, October 6th, at 7:00 PM.

This month we feature the movie "IRANIUM"

Iran’s nuclear program presents a threat to international stability.  Yet successive American administrations—Republican and Democratic alike—have misread the intentions and actions of the Iranian regime.

How dangerous is a nuclear Iran, even if it never detonates a weapon?  What are the guiding principles of the Iranian leadership?  To what lengths would the regime go to carry out its agenda?  How far have Iran’s leaders already gone to fund the world’s most powerful terrorist organizations?  And why have American leaders failed to gain the upper hand in relations with Iran during the past 30 years?

In approximately 60 minutes, Iranium powerfully reports on the many aspects of the threat America and the world now face using rarely-before seen footage of Iranian leaders, and interviews with 25 leading politicians, Iranian dissidents, and experts on: Middle East policy, terrorism, and nuclear proliferation.

Iranium documents the development of Iran’s nuclear threat, beginning with the Islamic Revolution of 1979 and the ideology installed by Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khomeini.Iranium tracks Iran’s use of terror as a tool of policy, beginning with the 444 day seizure of the U.S. Embassy in Tehran, through Iran’s insurgent actions in Iraq and Afghanistan.Iranium details the brutal nature of the Iranian regime to its own citizens, and the Iranian people’s desire to rejoin the international community.Iranium outlines the various scenarios the greater Middle East and the Western world may face should Iran cross the nuclear threshold. **************************************************************************

Also, "Bob Dann's Tea Party University", and his specially  hand picked "Video(s) of the Month".


***************************************************************************

Don't forget to purchase your 50/50 raffle tickets at all of our meetings. Last month's winner walked away with  $150.00! Get a full arm's length of tickets for only $10.00. You can use your arm, our arm, or the really tall guy with the long arms sitting next to you!!

Remember, we use the proceeds of our monthly raffle sales to help offset the costs of running our meetings. Please participate, and be generous!

*****************************************************************

Please Note:

Speakers and agenda times listed above are subject to change. With only a few exceptions our General Meetings are held the first Tuesday of every month from 7:00 to 9:00 PM at the American Legion Hall, 197 Maple Avenue Rockville Centre. All of our meetings are open to the public. Doors open around 6:30 for early-birds, shmoozers, and those wishing to help us set up the meeting. Our actual meeting begins at 7 PM.

All are welcome. Bring your neighbors, bring your friends!

We respectfully request that you RSVP your attendance to all of our meetings and events regardless of if you are able to attend or not. Simply click the link contained inside this invitation to RSVP.  Please do it now. Thank You.

Please Join us on October 6th

Guest Teacher 

Carl Chimon Viggiani, Sensei

We are fortunate to have Carl Viggiani, Sensei visit with us.

Carl is a Dharma Heir of Robert Kennedy, SJ, Roshi.

Carl began formal study of Zen Buddhism with the Japanese Teacher Eido Roshi in 1987, later moving to Dai Bosatsu Zendo, Eido Roshi's monastery in the Catskills, where he lived and practiced until 1993. He continued with Daido Loori Roshi at Zen Mountain Monastery, and with Roshi Robert Kennedy at Morning Star Zendo in Jersey City.

He will sit, offer daisan (one to one teaching) in the second period and a Dharma talk in the last period.

Please Join Us!

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.

results.description: "On what side does the breast stand? On the side of what sucks on the side of what is sucked? There is an ambiguity here which nalytic theory has sometimes been led to speak about in connection with the breast and the mother, by emphasizing of course that they aren't the same thing. Does qualifying the breast as a partial object say it aU? When I say amboceptor, I'm emphasizing that it is just as necessary to spell out the maternal subject's relation to the breast as the nursling's relation to the breast. The cut does not pass through the same spot for one as it does for the other. There are two cuts, which are so far apart that they leave different off-cuts. For the child, the cutting of the cord leaves the envelopes apart. These envelopes are consistent with him, continuous with his ectoderm and his endoderm. For the mother, the cut lies at the level of the placenta as it falls away. This is even why it is called the decidua. The deciduous character of the object a, which shapes its function, lies there. The falling-away, the niederfallen, is typical when approaching an a that is nonetheless more essential to the subject than any other part of himself."
results.name: JLW- Jacques Lacan Workshop Seminar X: Chapter XII

results.description:
Here is a unique opportunity to join a healing group that meets regularly to support your needs using the amazing potential of Tapping.

There will NOT be a lot of discussion or socializing because we will be too busy Tapping on specific and general issues of our Emtional and Physical concerns using EFT and something called Tong Ren.

EFT is well known for eliminating the causes of emotional distress. Many people are also aware of using EFT for physical well being. Sometimes we need to look at the emotional aspects that may be behind the issues of concern, and sometimes we just tap directly on the symptoms and notice if we get relief just from that. Its very nice when this happens and it happens a lot.

Tong Ren is another form of healing using tapping but unlike EFT it doesnt involve any dialog to describe the issues of concern. We just tap on a surragate model (Tong Ren) as if we were doing acupunture on a real body with intention of healing and it works!!!!

We'll meet at Jain's home in Scarsdale every 2nd and 4th Tuesday evening and whoever is interested in joining us is welcome. The only stipulation is that whatever issue you bring to our attention you let us tap on it.
results.name: Tapping Meetup for Emotional and Physical Healing with EFT and Tong Ren

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners with zero experience).  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
You are a multi-dimensional being arising as one occasion... 

(What?)

What that means is, in terms of your experience: (1) you have an experience of an interior to you (2) you have an experience of an exterior to you (3) you experience individual reality and (4) you experience shared reality. 

All of this is happening at the same time, in a co-mingled experience.

• Your individual interior is your Mind. 

• Your individual exterior is your Body.

• Your shared interior are your Relationships. 

• Your shared exterior is your Environment.

At the Meetup, we address the Environment -- our mutually shared exteriors.  But what's really cool is that since you're arising as one occasion, a supportive Environment supports your Body, Mind, and Relationships.

See you soon!

results.description:
2015 KALEIDOSCOPE VR FILM FESTIVAL

*****YOU MUST GET A TICKET ON EVENTBRITE TO ATTEND***** 

The penultimate stop of the Kaleidoscope VR Film Festival takes us to the Big Apple! We've curated 20 amazing virtual reality experiences made by independent artists from around the world. Come celebrate the pioneers of virtual reality filmmaking with an evening of artist presentations, VR demos, and engaging discussions.

And thanks to our sponsors Vrideo and Samsung you'll have the opportunity to experience the full line-up of films on Gear VR and Oculus Rift headsets. A live VR broadcast of the San Francisco event will be made by VideoStitch.

BUY TICKETS ON EVENTBRITE

SCHEDULE:
• 7:00pm to 8:00pm: The event is open only for VIP ticket holders.
• 8:00pm to 11:00pm: The event is open for general admission ticket holders.
• 8:30pm to 9:00pm: There will be a panel of VR Filmmakers discussing their work.

VR FILM PROGRAM:
BRIGHT SHADOWS  •  BUTTS  • COLOSSE  • DMZ: MEMORIES OF NO MAN'S LAND  •  DER GROSSE GOTTLIEB  •  LOVR  •  SIGHTLINE: THE CHAIR  •  SURGE  •  TANA PURA  •  THE ARCHER  •  THE LAST MOUNTAIN  •  THE NEPAL QUAKE PROJECT  •  THE NIGHT CAFÉ  •  WAY TO GO • WELCOME TO ALEPPO  • WITNESS 360: 7/7

VR DEMOS:
VRIDEO •  ALTSPACE VR •  CONDITION ONE  •  VIDEOSTITCH

ARTIST PANEL:

ARJAN VAN MEERTEN - Arjan is a director and Visual Effects artist from the Netherlands and creator of the VR music video SURGE. He co-founded the dutch animation studio "House of Secrets" and has over 11 years of experience in the industry. Having worked on commercials, movies and rides, he now focuses on virtual reality content. Next to his day job at the studio, he creates music videos for his own tracks.

MAC CAULEY - Artist, engineer, and animator Mac Cauley is the creator of The Night Café, a virtual reality experience that takes you inside a Vincent van Gogh painting. The Night Café won the grand prize for the Oculus VR Mobile Game Jam of 2015. 

AARON BRADBURY - Creator of the acclaimed VR film LoVR, Aaron is based in Derby England. By night he is a short film-maker, a lover and a fighter. By day a cg artist, tea drinker and enigma.

AVRAM DODSON - Avram is the director of the VR animation The Last Mountain. His previous film, Pistachio Milk, received the Golden Starfish at the Hampton International Film Festival and Best Student Short at Austin Film Festival. His work has also screened at South by Southwest. Prior to film, he received bachelor's degrees in chemistry and computer science from the University of Texas in Austin.
results.name: 2015 KALEIDOSCOPE VR FILM FESTIVAL

O'Connors has a great Trivia game going every Tuesday. Tom always has challenging and diverse questions, and our team usually wins! Game starts at 8:30, so let's try to arrive around 8 to get a good table and hang out a bit before it starts. Come to win a drink or two, make some new friends, see old ones, and play a fun and intellectually stimulating game of Trivia!

Great times and great friends!  New and returning members welcome!
results.name: Trivia Night!

results.description: The Fancy Show is the classiest and most hilarious comedy show you can find on a Tuesday night in Brooklyn. Come down to see some of the best comedians in the country, and share some good times with strangers. The Fancy Show regularly features comedians who have appeared on HBO, Comedy Central, NBC, FOX, TBS, FX and everywhere in between. The show is totally free, and we even give away a few drinks just for the hell of it. Hope to see you all there!

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].


Join members and friends of NYSN at The Firehouse Tavern and cheer on the Yankees in their 1 game playoff to get into the American League Division Series.  No need to be a baseball fan, we will have a fun atmosphere for all.  The Firehouse tavern has a great pub menu with wings, burgers, pizza, salads and more! The game will be show on dozens of large screens.

How it works:

-Sign up and show up.  Dave will be on hand with a special table set aside for NYSN members to use as a home base to socialize.  If you would like to sit, eat and watch the game we will try to reserve tables for you but let us know ahead of time you would like to sit.

Can I come alone?  Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own

How will I find the group?  Dave will have a sign at one of the tables as you walk in to the left.  Our members will have name tags on.

What does it cost?  It is FREE to get in and just pay as you go for food and drinks.  Separate checks no problem.

Come early for our Trivia Night from 6:30pm-8pm

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
"Dating, Sex, Relationships and Marriage- The Ultimate LIVE Dating Q&A"
with Relationship Coach, and Author Roy Biancalana

FREE Pre-Dating Teleseminar

WHEN: Tuesday, October 6th, 2015 from 8:30 PM to 9:45 PM (ET)
SPEAKER:with Relationship Coach, and Author Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating Speed Dating C.O.O. and Relationship Coach, Michael Clarke
WHO'S INVITED: This Teleseminar is Open to EVERYONE
HOW MUCH: Complimentary!
HOW TO RSVP: http://predatingteleseminar.eventbrite.com

"Dating, Sex, Relationships and Marriage- The Ultimate LIVE Dating Q&A"

with Relationship Coach, and Author Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating Speed Dating C.O.O. and Relationship Coach, Michael Clarke

In this crazy new world of dating, we know you have tons of questions that need answering! So, we're taking a different approach on September's Teleseminar, as we have realized that you, the audience, want to ask questions on an array of different subjects and topics! Instead of our typical 45 minute guest speaker presentation, this month- Relationship Coach Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating C.O.O., Michael Clarke will answer your questions directly through a constructive and informative seminar built to help you succeed in finding a lasting, emotionally and physically fulfilling relationship.

What you need to do to be fully prepared:

Write down a few questions that you would like to have answered, no questions are off the table!

Bring an open-mind

And that’s it!

PLUS RSVP NOW TO GET THESE BONUSES:

Deep discounts on Pre-Dating Speed Dating Events

30 minute Free Coaching Session with Roy Biancalana

Raffle for Free Dating Events

Raffle for 1 of 5 Free Books from Roy Biancalana

Free access to Roy's "The Attraction Factor" Video Series

ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS - Author Roy Biancalana and Pre-Dating Speed Dating C.O.O. and Relationship Coach, Michael Clarke:

Roy Biancalana is known as "The Intimacy Guru," and is a nationally recognized leader in the field of attraction, intimacy and conscious relationships. He appears regularly on Fox35 TV in Orlando, FL as their relationship expert and is the author of the book, "A Drink with Legs" sold worldwide.

Roy is a certified relationship coach, spiritual teacher and was a PGA Tour player. His passion is working with men and women who are committed to awakening to their true spiritual nature and experiencing the love life they most desire. He specializes in supporting single people in attracting the love of their lives and also helping those who are in committed partnerships experience a deeper level of intimacy. He has clients all over the world and coaches by phone, Skype or in person.

Michael Clarke has been working with singles over the last 8 years on both the business end of two of the largest singles companies in the world as well as one-on-one through his coaching business. Michael's main focus within his coaching is to help people absolve any past relationship struggles, and to help his clients turn thier focus on themselves and how to be the very best person they can be before stepping back out into the dating scene.

Michael has been interviewed on dozens of radio stations, including "Date Therapy with Dr. Tranquility", "The Dating Jungle Live" with Tara Richter, as well as Tampa Bay's Fox News, and many others.

Missed a past teleseminar? Recordings available at http://www.pre-dating.com/teleseminar/

REMEMBER:

If you somehow can't make the call, everyone who RSVPs will receive access to the recording replay and bonuses in a follow-up email after this free teleseminar.

**Although this a FREE teleseminar, standard long distance charges may apply. Listeners may listen online as well, an online audio link will also be supplied when you RSVP.

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We are on 135 Thames St. 11237 btwn Porter Ave & Varick, across from the GHETTY gas station and flushing AVE! just one block from the Loom! Take the Jefferson L (1 long block) or Morgan L (about 5-6 blocks)!!
results.name: Improv Comedy CLASS every TUES @ 830pm in Bushwick Brooklyn 11237!

results.description:
Guess who's part of NY Super Week? WE ARE! It's true! (for more info about all the exciting offerings of SuperWeek, see below).

This event is hosted by an outside organization, so you'll have to order tickets through their site, below, as they will not honor RSVPs from this Meetup.
http://www.newyorksuperweek.com/en/Sessions/14489/Draw-mania-Figure-Drawing-at-New-York-Super-Week-Session-One

Draw-mania! in association with New York Super Week bring another exciting figure drawing session to a great metropolitan happening!
Grab your favorite art materials and your most creative friends, and come join us for a session of dynamic figure drawing with a terrific art model! You'll have the opportunity to sketch from both short and long poses, and this will be a great session for beginning artists as well as old pros. Figure drawing is one of the most important skills in an artist's repertoire, and for comic artists it's absolutely vital. It's also an awful lot of fun! We'll be featuring one skilled female art model at each session. The model will be interestingly costumed. The shortest poses will be 30 seconds long, and the longest poses will be 20 minutes. Art materials are NOT provided (suggested materials are a sketch pad or notebook, 11x14" or smaller, and charcoal, graphite, watercolor, pencil or pen are recommended).

Further questions? Contact <a>[masked]</a>

About New York Super Week:
New York Super Week is a first of its kind pop culture festival. For one week the entire city of New York will become a playground for super heroes, villains, vampires, zombies, geeks and passionate fans of all sizes. With different pop culture themed experiences happening in every corner of the City – including concerts, comedy shows, gaming events, lectures, podcasts, storytelling, food tastings and more – New York Super Week is an immersive and inclusive experience that aims to bring the energy, passion and color of the entire universe of popular culture to every corner of all five boroughs of New York City. The event will take place October 2-11, 2015 leading into the East Coast’s biggest and most exciting popular culture convention, New York Comic Con.
http://www.newyorksuperweek.com
results.name: Draw-mania! Figure Drawing at New York Super Week!

group.name: Figure Drawing NYC--Summer Sketch Group and Draw-mania!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
results.how_to_find_us: soccer, indoor soccer, futsal, new york futsal, futsal across america, futbol, futbolito, fifa
results.name: 9:00pm/Tuesday UWS

results.description:
This is an absentee / distant / remote meetup where members can receive therapeutic energy from the comfort of their own home.

INVITATION & INFO

This note invites you and reminds previous participants to our weekly Energy Flux group on Tuesday nights.  Some of you may wish to include a friend or situation that you have a concern about to this group  as well (see instructions below).

You can participate wherever you happen to be at 9 pm.  PLEASE RSVP BY 8:30 PM EDT TUESDAY, IF YOU'D LIKE TO JOIN OR REMAIN.  Your response means you're aware of facilitating a growth and/or healing issue.  You may also participate for enjoyment, relaxation and general therapeutic effect.  You can request to participate for a longer period, e.g., an entire season or number of months.

If you can not reply until after 8:30 please join in anyhow and tell me afterwards.  This group is organized on weekly basis with reminders.

If you stop RSVP-ing you will not be included on the Energy Flux after a month (something good may have happened when we forget)!  Either way feedback is welcome (many fascinating and  wonderful accounts of our activity).

Besides Tuesday night, I may tune into this list as guided during various other times, some of which may be announced.  The therapeutic energy is universal and multi-modal (synthesizing a personal energy based modality, Reiki, TT, etc.).

INSTRUCTIONS

Short and simple intructions will be emailed to you after an RSVP is received.

$12 suggested donation.  Participants may contribute more or less based on their lifestyle.  Larger donations naturally support those with less financial resources and the continuation of Unu's activities.
results.why: We receive enjoyment, relaxation and general therapeutic feeling and healing through Energy Flux.
results.how_to_find_us: Participate In Your Own Location
results.name: Energy Flux

results.description:
Hey Guys,

The 7v7 Co-Ed Tournament is back this Fall, Oct 10th.

15% early bird offer is extended to October 6th!


At signup apply code: Fall15. Team & free-agent registration at: http://www.group-stage.com/1daytourny/

World Cup format. All players receive team jerseys and post tournament drink specials in the LES! The Champions win trophies! Minimum 4 games so everyone gets plenty of game time.


DETAILS:

• Teams are 7v7, max roster 10 players


•  22min matches, unlimited subs

• Players receive GSF T-shirt


•  Finalists awarded medals

•  2 female players required during matches

There are so many important aspects of our business world that we have discussed at our meetings and this specific topic is in no way insignificant.  In fact, without the expertise of someone like Randy Bier, of Cartridge World in Franklin Lakes, we could not  keep our business at its most efficient.  The need of printers, copiers, paper supplies, inks & toners, and their subsequent repairs is paramount to our company's efficiency and success.  Mr. Bier from Cartridge World is here to explain what he has available to us at substantial discounts from the large super stores.   Cartridge World of Franklin Lakes has a 100% guarantee, environmentally friendly supplies, and new invitation to us today to enable us to sign up to purchase our supplies from him and receive a new color or black and white laser printer at no cost to use for 2 years. Cartridge World is able to makes our printing work easy, while reducing costs and increasing productivity.


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

results.description:
YOU MUST PURCHASE A TICKET AT THE LINK BELOW

The Council of Urban Real Estate (CURE) was founded in 1990. CURE’s mission is to pursue diversity and inclusion within the commercial real estate, land use and development industries, while empowering emerging real estate professionals. Join CURE today for an annual fee of $100. dollars and receive complimentary admission to “Real Estate Financing through the EB-5 Program." 

Enter discount code “hamer” for 50% off non-member tickets

RSVP

HERE

The EB-5 Immigrant Investor Program provides foreign nationals with a method of obtaining permanent resident status (green card), in return for investing money in job creating commercial enterprises in the United States. To be eligible for EB-5 classification, applicants must invest at least $1 million (or 500K in a Targeted Employment Area) in a commercial enterprise that will create at least 10 full-time jobs for U.S. workers. The Council of Urban Real Estate has gathered a panel of experts which include an EB5 attorney from the oldest Immigration law Firm in the United States, a nationally recognized “Top 25″ corporate and securities EB-5 attorney, a “Best Lawyer’s in America” recipient with an expertise in the EB-5 program, a top ranked accounting and advisory firm, and a well known regional center. This panel will discuss: 

• The history of the EB-5 Visa program

• The EB-5 Visa Immigration process

• How developers can use the EB-5 Visa program to fund their projects

• New developments in the EB-5 program resulting from the “Leahy-Grassley Bill”

Schedule
8:00 - 8:30am Registration, networking & continental breakfast
8:30- 10:00am Program
10:00-10:30am Networking Limited Seating
All attendees receive a complimentary copy of EB-5 Investors Magazine

Price:

Free for C.U.R.E. members

$25.00 for Non-members

Join CURE today for an annual fee of $100. dollars and receive complimentary admission to “Real Estate Financing through the EB-5 Program." Go HERE to join CURE


You MUST RSVP HERE

Enter discount code “hamer” for 50% off non-member tickets

Speakers: Clem Turner, Esq., Homeier & Law, P.C
Steve Polivy, Esq., Akerman, LLP
Sam Newbold, Esq. Barst, Mukamel & Kleiner, LLP
Joe McCarthy, Esq., American Dream Fund Regional Center
Joanne Chiu, CPA, Marks Paneth, LLP

Don’t miss this opportunity to join the Council of Urban Real Estate, and learn about the EB-5 Immigrant Investor Program from our panel of top experts in the field.

You MUST RSVP HERE

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

Fit by Laura is bringing back workouts at Carl Schurz Park...  *Please sign up in advance to ensure that class will be held*  

Please sign up here...  

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=221913

Outdoor class single class is $30.  Package and monthly plans also available. Please check out the Fit by Laura complete schedule on her website.  You'll see a complete schedule of classes.  http://www.mamafitbylaura.com


*****Other options for East Side classes can be available to our group as well.  If you're interested in finding out more or hosting, please contact Myrna and we can discuss further.*****

The Fit by Laura Workout: Your life; your workout.

For two and a half years, we have brought you a challenging total body workout. The workout constantly moves between cardio intervals and body toning segments with a focus on the abs and glutes, and relies primarily if not exclusively on body weight exercises.  Whether you are relatively new to fitness or a seasoned boutique fitness studio expert, there is something for everyone with our workout. It is not just new moms who have trouble finding the time for fitness; it is the busy executive who travels a ton and works north of 100 hours a week; it is the news producer, who I used to be, that on a moments notice is on a plane to cover the latest natural disaster; it is the single mom or dad who cannot leave their child at home alone. The Fit by Laura workout gets you FIT while making it FIT into your life and modifying every workout to FIT your body and needs.

results.description:
Hello,

7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.

Don't be late, we start on time!


This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014


--------------------------------------------------------------------

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strenthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 1:00 PM – 2:30 PM

Day: Wednesdays

Where: Room #102, Freeport Recreation Center

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card.  The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

 -------------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

You can make a jewelry by yourself at Ayaka Nishi Jewelry Design School in East Village. 
We provide semi-private classes with a small number of only four students per class.

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

For this event, you must register at the <a>APC-NYC website</a>. (Do not register on our Meetup page.)

The Advertising Production Club of NYC (APC-NYC) will present an evening of industry professionals from some extraordinary companies to discuss the trends taking place and how these technologies are being integrated into the brand/story, consumer engagement experience.

Come see and learn what you need to know about how technology is driving Production in our business and hear from this esteemed panel of experts what is necessary to remain agile and adaptable in the fast lane of TECHNOLOGY.


Mark Benussi, AKQA Director of Technology and Operations - AKQA is a leading/global digital agency that specializes in creating digital services and products.

Carolyn Johnson, Google Americas Brand Activation Lead – Google is…..Google

Matt Myers, Tidal Lab CEO/Co-Founder – Tidal Produces Organic Content Creations & puts Creative Control in the Hands of Influencers

Chris Searson, Digital Evolution VP Director of Operations - Digital Evolution is an award-winning creative production studio focusing on the creation of commercial work

MODERATOR: Christy King, Levels Beyond Inc. COO – Levels Beyond Inc. is the company behind Reach Engine, a media inventory software platform.

To register, click <a>here</a>.
results.name: What's new in Production Technology for Advertising?

results.description:
SAVE THE DATE! 10/7


Technology continues to move at such an accelerated rate. In order to keep the consumer fully engaged, we who produce and manage the creative process, market, brand, and help to tell stories, have to explore, experience and re-educate all the time. The learning process is continual.


In our business today, the drive and push behind innovation is ‘technology’. (CGI, video, gaming, software, Augmented Reality, Interactive Paper, 3D and more) Digital, retail, mobile, social, experiential, broadcast, video, gaming and print are all experiencing significant changes and the intersection points keep moving forward.


With all the media available, are YOU successfully moving with the trends in technology?


The APC-NYC will present an evening of industry professionals from some extraordinary companies to discuss the trends taking place and how these technologies are being integrated into the brand/story, consumer engagement experience.  Come see and learn what you need to know about how technology is driving Production in our business and hear from this esteemed panel of experts what is necessary to remain agile and adaptable in the fast lane of TECHNOLOGY.

Mark Benussi AKQA Director of Technology and Operations - AKQA is a leading/global digital agency that specializes in creating digital services and products.

results.description:
Join Chelsea Fertility of New York City on October 7th for an informative IVF + PGD workshop!


The evening’s activities will include wine and light fare, a raffle for a FREE IVF cycle, and an in-depth question and answer session with two of the nation’s top fertility doctors – Dr. Hartog and Dr. Gindoff. Bring your partner and join us on October 7th at 6:00PM to learn about:


• When is IVF with PGD recommended?

• How does IVF with PGD work?

results.description:
Overview: 

This talk intends to seed your mind with the inspiration, fundamentals, and current best practices to help your brand enter the video content creation community without breaking the bank. 

We'll be covering: 

1) Video ideation (aka pre-production) 

2) Video creation (aka production & post production) 

3) Video distribution (aka publication & optimization)

Guest Speaker:

Devin Rogerino is an NYC area based video producer who specializes in the new media space. After graduating, with honors, from Syracuse University Devin had the opportunity to produce and edit video with brands: CNBC, PEOPLE, InStyle, Entertainment Weekly. 


Later, Devin was selected to run Time Inc.'s, first of its kind, multichannel YouTube network, managing revenue and subscriber growth for over 21 branded YouTube channels.


Currently he is Executive Producer of Video at Inc. Media.

About the Venue: 

Thank you to our partner Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.

So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today!

results.description:
This meetup is about coming together to hear what we all are working on, pitching new ideas, discussing our needs to begin and finish projects, and helping to make it happen.  Please be sure to answer the RSVP questions fully to help ensure this meetup is successful.


During our time together, there will be an allocated time where each member gets an opportunity to introduce him/herself and their experience level. Those who are ready to launch projects/or are looking for writing collaborators will have three minutes to pitch her/his idea to the room, with (if needed) an extra minute to mention above and below the line needs in terms of crew, locations, extras, support, phone calls, whatever. Following the pitches, we will then break into an informal session of conversation, where we can talk among ourselves about the pitches and our experience, offer advice, get to know one another, form crews, etc.


We firmly believe that you don't need money to make films, and creative projects, all you really need is friends.


Let's do it.

>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

YOU SURVIVED THE SUMMER. NOW ENJOY FALL'S FIRST OP.LOUNGE AT LOW COST OR NO COST!

On Wednesday, October 7, Out Professionals welcomes you to autumn’s inaugural edition of OP.LOUNGE, our casual, after-work networking series.

It’s smart to start fall by connecting with others socially and professionally. That’s why Out Professionals … OP.LYNX, our dynamic women’s network … and OP.PRIME, the network for up-and-coming LGBT professionals are coming together tonight.

The scene? Industry, the sprawling, 4000-square-foot Hell’s Kitchen hotspot. “Those seeking a more intimate scene will find plenty of private nooks and comfy couches,” reassures Time Out New York.

“You can’t be gay without going to Hell’s Kitchen bars,” says Paper Magazine, “and this one is the shiniest and most happening.” “The sexiest bar in midtown, with 0 attitude,” says FourSquare. “Voted the best gay bar by New York Magazine and Village Voice” — CBSlocal.com.

Tonight every OP partygoer — Member or nonmember, pre-registered or walk-in — enjoys a generous OP Exclusive: Everything, including top-shelf brands, 2-4-1 until 10 p.m.!


WHERE

Industry, 355 West 52nd Street, between Eighth and Ninth Avenues. Subway: Number 1/C/E to 50th Street; N/Q/R to 49th Street; B/D/F/M to 47th-50th Streets.

WHAT’S UP

Socializing and networking from 6 p.m. Everything 2-4-1, top-shelf brands included, with Happy Hour extended until 10 p.m. for Out Professionals patrons only. “The drinks are stiffly poured” — NYC.COM.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $10. Pre-registered, dues-paying OP Member, free. OP dues-payer at the door, $5. Please print and pocket your online receipt. Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER!

Enjoy a 12-month individual Out Professionals Membership (new or renewal) PLUS free admission to tonight’s event for just $65. And remember, that buys you a whole year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost networking and socializing! Order here.

venue.name: Microsoft

results.description:
Hi hardwarians,

After a bit of a hiatus, we're back with more amazing presenters bringing you the latest and greatest in the NY hardware scene. Looking forward to catching up with you all after the Summer!

Agenda:

6:00 - 6:15pm: arrival, pizza and beer

6:15 - 6:25pm: welcome and sponsors

6:25 - 6:40pm: Geof Lipman, Director of Engineering at LittleBits, and Alin Cosmanescu, senior engineer, will talk about how the company is going from startup to "bigger" company and some of the engineering challenges on the way, as well as showing you some cool demos of what they're up to! 

6:40- 6:55pm: Phyl Georgiou, CEO of Tiggly, will talk about how they developed their interactive toys for kids, building both hardware and apps to enhance the learning and playing experience.

6:55 - 7:10pm: Mason Klement, co-CEO at Smartakus, a company that designs, manufactures and sells electronic accessories for digital nomads who genuinely care about both their productivity and style. Hear how he just planted himself in China, learned Mandarin and became an expert in manufacturing goods.

7:10 - 7:25pm: Christopher Ayala, CEO of Vertisense, a company that develops connected sensor technologies for non-invasive measurement of human conditions, allowing users to track and monitor their personal health data. Hear about how they developed their own smart phone connected breathalyzer.

7:25pm - onwards: networking and community announcements.

See you all there!

Haytham

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Join us for a regular play scrimmage session. (If you don't have experience kayaking w/ a skirt--rolling or doing a wet exit--please attend one of our Intro Sessions first. Come early to get set up if you need to use club gear. We hope to be on the water close to 6:30.

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo). 

We may or may not set up a goal for this session, depending on numbers, but we can play the "football" version which is good fun and helps with your passing game.
results.how_to_find_us: W 26th St @ Hudson River (middle of the boathouse or on back deck)
results.name: Regular Session (P66)

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
ADDED!  Guest speaker Julie Grahame!

Julie will present projects from her online magazine, and discuss about how she finds the photographers, what she wants to see in a series and what you could do to share your own photos.

Julie is a consultant, portfolio reviewer, writer and speaker. She’s a photography judge for a number of non-profits and contributing writer for PDN's Emerging Photographer and EDU magazines. Julie is the publisher of one of the ten best photo sites named by the British Journal of Photography, aCurator and the associated aCurator blog. She represents the estate of noted Canadian photographer Yousuf Karsh and is a member of American Society of Picture Professionals (ASPP) and American Photography Archive Group (APAG).


We’re still keeping our agenda for the two Davids!

Send in your questions in advance via the NYC Lightroom Meetup web page for the event and D.A. and David will do their damnedest to answer them. Or, if you have a specific image you need help with, drop a camera raw file (with your initials in the name) onto our NYCLRMG folder [http://bit.ly/1NuZbZ8] (limit one per member) and we’ll spend the evening exploring solutions to your post-production challenges.*

Plus, we will be giving away 4 free copies of PhotoTraces' Lightroom developer module presets ! You can learn more about the presets here: http://www.phototraces.com/store/

*ALL submitted photos will be deleted after the Meetup.
results.name: It’s The All Request Lightroom Meetup w/ Special Guest Julie Grahame!

results.description:
THE LIGHT OF SOUTHERN ITALY Paintings from the 19th-Century Neapolitan School


Wednesday, October,[masked] 6PM


<a>by RSVP only</a>


Cocktail Attire Required


The "Neapolitan School" of the 19th century encompasses a wide range of artistic schools, stylistic currents and geographic regions on the peninsula stretching from Molise to the Abruzzo region and from Sicilia to Puglia.


For the first time, 34 unique paintings from private collections are on view in the U.S, including works of artists of the caliber of Filippo Palizzi, Francesco Paolo Michetti, Giuseppe De Nittis and Antonio Mancini,  to name a few.


A common objective links this selection of paintings: the quest to capture and harness sunlight in all of its moods, personalities and permutations.


The poetry of these paintings lies in the overall landscaping and lighting effect conveyed depending upon the time of day, changing seasons, or sudden change in weather. The prevalent use of chiaroscuro, the strong juxtaposition of light and shadow to depict the ever changing lights of the Mediterranean vividly animates these representations of natural imagery and spectacular locations along the jagged coastline.


 This exhibit wants to honor those forebears that embarked on a most courageous journey across the ocean in search of a better life for their families. It is also a reminder to the Italian-Americans of their vibrant and beautiful heritage.


Exhibition curated by Marco Bertoli


On view from October, 7 to November,[masked]


Monday through Saturday 

10:00am to 5:00 pm
results.name: FREE EVENT (by RSVP only): THE LIGHT OF SOUTHERN ITALY

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 4:00PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club programs or activities.

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE:  RSVP HERE IS A VOTE OF CONFIDENCE + WE APPRECIATE IT! CLICK HERE TO RSVP ON THE AIANY SITE.


We're looking forward to celebrating Archtober with a TAP event exploring coworking and its diverse impact on the architectural practice and product.

As the landscape of work shifts to accommodate more mobility and flexibility, coworking has become more and more popular. This model, which brings together a variety of individuals and organizations to share a workspace, is intended to encourage knowledge sharing and community-building among professionals who would not otherwise be connected. It is changing the traditional way we look at the relationship between space and professional communities. How can architecture and design accommodate these trends and prepare for a more flexible future? How might architects themselves be using diverse work environments to leverage the benefits for doing their own work? We must be equipped to design for clients who desire facilitation of greater connection, communication and choice, in a variety of environments. This session will explore the evolution of coworking and its impact on both what and how we might be designing in the future.

Panelists:

Rosemarie Ryan is a renowned leader, brand builder and rabble-rouser in the marketing industry. Rosemarie began her career in account planning and was among the first wave of Brits to import the Account Planning discipline to the United States at Chiat Day. As president of K&B, she took it from a 30-person boutique to a 400-person strong award-winning agency. She then took on the mantle of leading the 125 year-old JWT into the 21st century. In her tenure she restructured the workplace, the teams and creative product, and doubled the profits of the agency. Not satisfied with reinventing an agency, she decided it was time to reinvent the industry. In September of 2010, Rosemarie, along with her creative partner Ty Montague, left JWT and founded co:collective. Co: is a Storydoing collective focused on business and brand transformation and is fortunate enough to be working with likes of YouTube, Infiniti, Google  and Timberland. In September 2012, Rosemarie was named as one of the '100 most influential Women in Advertising’ by Advertising Age.

</a>

<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/billdowzer">Bill Dowzer is a strategic leader with specialist expertise in workplace architecture and a Principal of BVN, an award-winning Australian architectural practice. Bill is a leader in workplace design and a champion of BVN’s ‘collective creation’ approach, underpinned by a belief that great workplaces are not about the space alone, but the about people and the making of ‘place’. As an agile design studio with a unique ability to apply ‘translational’ thinking across sectors, BVN’s broad portfolio is testament to the practice’s ability to constantly evolve to suit contemporary needs and expectations. Bill is currently leading the start-up of BVN’s New York Studio and has a strong interest in the design and impact of co-working and dynamic workplace environments. He is currently working with Liquidspace, Westfield and GPT on environments for new economy businesses. Graduating from The University of Newcastle with the University and RAIA medals Bill has lectured and taught at numerous Australian universities. He is the former Studio Director of the BVN Sydney Studio and established and led the BVN Melbourne Studio from 2000-05.

Pay Wu is a Vice President in American Express’ Global Business Services division, focused on Global Real Estate and Workplace Enablement. Pay leads American Express’ innovative workplace strategy, BlueWork, a leading flexible workplace program offering many of the same features as coworking in a corporate setting. Pay and her team are also responsible for end-to-end real estate delivery and customer relationship management for the Americas Portfolio. Wu spent her formative years in professional services at Deloitte and holds a BS in Design, Environmental Analysis, and Facilities Planning from Cornell University.

Melissa Marsh is part researcher and part innovator. Leveraging a background in the social sciences with a Master of Architecture at MIT, Melissa defined an early career building cross-disciplinary consulting practices within a number of leading architectural firms. Interested in further exploring the intersection of design and human factors research, Melissa started her own interdisciplinary consultancy firm. PLASTARC, a portmanteau of plastic and architecture, employs social research, design metrics and real estate strategy to create a more flexible and engaging built world. Melissa leads a diverse team - from sociologists to data visualizers - dedicated to shifting the metrics associated with space from square feet and inches to occupant satisfaction and performance. An active contributor to many professional communities, Melissa curates the AIANY Transforming Architectural Practice series which promotes the advancement of the business of architecture through greater dialogue with other disciplines, including technology, real estate, business strategy, marketing, and law.

Moderator: 

Greg Lindsay is a senior fellow of the New Cities Foundation — where he leads the Connected Mobility Initiative — a non-resident senior fellow of The Atlantic Council’s Strategic Foresight Initiative, and a visiting scholar at New York University’s Rudin Center for Transportation Policy & Management. Greg is also a contributing writer for Fast Company, and co-author of Aerotropolis: The Way We’ll Live Next. Greg speaks frequently about globalization, innovation, and the future of cities, most recently at Microsoft Research, McKinsey, the U.S. State Department, the Canada Council for the Arts, and the Venice Architecture Biennale. Greg has advised Intel, Audi, Ericsson, Samsung, André Balazs Properties, and Toyota, among other organizations. His work with Studio Gang Architects on the future of suburbia was displayed at MoMA in 2012. Greg is a two-time Jeopardy! champion (and the only human to go undefeated against IBM’s Watson). 

Learning objectives: 


1. Understand the business model and design principles behind coworking


2. See how coworking has influenced other types of architecture and design

3. Understand the value of diverse and multi-disciplinary spaces for architectural practice


4. Brainstorm ideas for bringing coworking principles into your design practice.
results.name: Coworking and the Future of Architecture

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!

Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.
