results.description:
On the heels of the Haskell Book Club, we're exploring different languages that are on the fringe of usefulness and popularity.

We're exploring Erlang (http://www.erlang.org/) this month, which is used most notably to keep apps like WhatsApp running.

At the end of the meeting we'll spin the wheel of programming languages to see what next month holds!

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.  

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

results.description:
The Place:

The recipient of one Michelin star, Luksus offers a set menu of Scandinavian-influenced New American fare served in a snug space at the rear of a bar.
A vet of some of the globe’s highest-profile kitchens, including Noma, the Fat Duck and Momofuku (he’s the former R&D head), Daniel Burns rockets past moules frites and Belgian suds with his beer-pairing fare: vinegar-powder-dusted ham chips; raw razor clams with bone marrow, radish and cucumber vinaigrette; and a rhubarb-beet dessert featuring woodruff meringue and pea-and-anise-hyssop sorbet. For beverage pairings, there’s nary a wine list or cocktail menu in sight in the oak-paneled dining room—all courses are served exclusively with beer from the white-marble bar, curated by Tørst’s owner, legendary gypsy brewer Jeppe Jarnit-Bjergsø

Please note that we will be doing the tasting menu.

Prepay: Given the restaurant requires a credit card and charges for no shows, I am asking for $115 up front. This money will be refunded when you arrive at the restaurant. Venmo is the easiest way to pay but Paypal and Chase Quickpay also work.


The prepay is not refundable but you can transfer your spot to someone else in the group if you are unable to attend.


As always:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Luksus at Torst

results.description:
WOMEN ONLY EVENT. Meeting a MAN in NYC is not the easiest of tasks. What makes it even tougher is if you don't have a reliable friend to help navigate the NYC single scene. 

Come meet your new BFF at our Ladies Networking Night!

Every single woman needs a dependable friend, equally motivated to go out with you to parties, clubs, bars, and everything else as single women we don't want to hit "solo." 

Meet up to 30 other "single and fabulous" women (30s & 40s) at our upscale speed networking event.  Also, enjoy $4 beer and $5 wine drink specials. 

We'll start you off in groups where you'll get to meet 3-4 women at a time and then we'll transition to a less formal mixer where you all can mingle at your leisure. 

This is a PREPAY ONLY EVENT. NO tickets sold at the door.

1st 5 women to get tickets save $5 by using discount code "BFF" at checkout  ($20)  MUST BUY TICKET IN ADVANCE - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wing/dates/Oct-07-2015_at_0730PM

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)

results.description:
Autumn in Upstate New York: The leaves are changing, the weather is colder, and the air is filled with mystery...

The Goodman couple is dead, their eyes plucked out of their sockets. Their children are nowhere to be found. News of this echoes through the state, and the major freeholds of New York, having heard rumors of the small town, send their best couriers to investigate. You will play as these couriers, operating under the guise of FBI agents, to get to the bottom of this mystery, and to discover what's really going on in this town.

Taking a few pages of Twin Peaks and Welcome to Night Vale, The Town of Cinderella is a 3 session game for the month of October that will delve into the mysteries of small-town New York.

Pre-gens will be provided. Knowledge of Changeling The Lost is helpful, but not necessary. Newbies welcome!

I'll repeat the Google Wallet instructions for those unaccustomed: ***In the notes section of the payment, please leave your name and what event you are paying for! Thanks
-Download the Google Wallet app on your phone. You'll have to have a gmail account to register your username with this service if you don't already have gmail (in that case create a gmail account first... I did the same thing awhile back just to use this service)

- Create a 4 digit PIN to sign into Google Wallet. Then you'll be on the app homepage. -The left button says 'send money'. Click it and you'll have a screen where you can input a name or email address. My email address for this is [masked] .

-Once you input my username you'll see the screen where you type in the dollar amount. Once done, click the gray 'next', then the blue 'review' button in the upper right corner. -This takes to a confirmation screen. If anything looks off just click the left button on the upper lefthand side to go back a page. Otherwise, you confirm it and click send. Done! An icon will appear in your notifications area letting you know it's sent to me.

From now on, every event will not require a payment to rsvp on this page, I will check the rsvps daily to make sure everyone followed up - any issues message me on here and we will figure it out. Please work with me and send the payment when you register for the event... after this first set up it will take ten seconds each week. If you register and don't pay within 24 hours i'll reach out to you and then have to open the spot back up.. work with me here please, that would not be fun

results.name: Mindful Breathing and Meditation

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON NYC

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Join us for a mixed levels mellow vinyasa yoga class.  With just the right amount of alignment cues and modifications this flow will be intuitive and appropriately challenging for all, whether you are a beginner or advanced practitioner.

The vinyasa style of yoga links the yoga poses (asanas) with the breath, focusing as much on the transitions from pose to pose, as on the actual poses.  This class starts with a mindful and centering warm-up, building into a moderately paced yoga flow and allowing for deeper stretches and longer holds toward the end of the class. By the final pose, savasana, your body and mind will feel totally prepared to melt into a blissful state of peace and relaxation.

Pricing: $10 per student.  

Please make an effort to arrive 5 to 15 minutes in advance of class and always RSVP (even if it's last moment).  If you need to be late, please walk-in and set up as quietly as you can.  Thank you.
results.name: Vinyasa Yoga (with Jeni)

results.description:
Bachata Class-

This is a advanced beginner class that that builds comfortability with the basics of Bachata dancing. The class warm-up will focus on footwork, turns, body movement and proper technique. Students will learn about proper frame and connection in order to build comfort with leading and following, all while learning a fun dance pattern to use on their next romantic night out!

* The class will include a 10 minute social dance session in order to encourage dancers to practice their new material, along with building comfort and confidence in a fun and relaxed atmosphere!

Participation fee: $15 per person or $50 for 4-week session

This is a weekly class that is regularly attended, the attendance shown for this event does not reflect the full attendance of the class, space is limited - Please RSVP if you would like to join us! 

New to our studio? Try your first class for FREE!

Like us on Facebook and E-mail us your full name along with which class you would like to attend, and your first class is on us!

You can find more information about our classes and events by visiting our Web-site, Spirare Dance Studio.

You can also find us on Facebook, Spirare Dance.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session:
Sept 30, 2015- Nov 4, 2015
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125407<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=625347764"></a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
Amayah is a belly dancer who has studied the art of middle eastern styles of dance as well as more contemporary styles of the art form. Although she has been a dancer of other styles her whole life, Amayah fell in love with belly dance upon attending Rutgers University. She auditioned and was accepted into the Rutgers Belly Dance Troupe, and very next year she was elected to be the dance coach and choreographer, a position held until graduation. Amayah has trained with belly dancers of different styles from all over the world, such as Nourhan Sharif, Zoe Jakes, Luna of Cairo, and does extensive work with Jehan Kamal and her Raqstar troupe. She is currently living and dancing in NYC, is a member of Columbia Belly Dance, where she is a Master's in Clinical Psychology student. Amayah dances mainly dances Egyptian styles, and seeks to change the negative, sexual connotation that is commonly associated with belly dance.


Call[masked] to book your table
results.name: Amayah Bellydancing

results.description:
Forch of Nature Music Group proudly presents: "The Shed".

The Shed is a monthly jam session catering to New York City's hottest Hip Hop, Soul and Jazz musicians. The showcase is a platform for progressive music as well as a place for artist to build their chops. While occasionally heating the stage themselves, The Shed's hosts Anu~Sun, Augi and Bria Monèt will introduce you to some of New York's finest underground talent and surprise guests.

To learn more about The Shed, visit them on Instagram: www.instagram.com/theshedopenjam

Below is a music vibe example of The Shed house band when they were at Tammany Hall earlier this year, led by HarlemGo Meetup member Anu The Giant, however all genre of music is welcome to come share their talent.

http://youtu.be/Rg3PmE6dAAQ

Past Performances at #TheShed Include:

Robert Glasper, James Poysner (of The Roots), Mark Kelley (of The Roots), Raymond Angry (of The Roots), RC and The Gritz (Erykah Badu’s backing band), Big Yuki, Marcus Strickland, Jaleel Shaw, Jerimiah Abiah

Our Meetup

Daniel will be downstairs in Silvana at 9:00pm to hold seats for group members attending. Showtime starts around 9:30pm and goes to midnight. If you are interested in performing this evening, be sure to arrive early (between 9:30-10:00pm) and sign-up on the performing list at the venue. As always, if there are any questions, you're running late, etc. feel free to reach him at 774.275.3646.

Directions of Silvana:

Silvana is located at 300 W 116th St., between Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Ave.) and Manhattan Ave. in Central Harlem. The closest subway stop is the B & C local train lines to the 116th Street station. Nearby bus lines include the M10, M7, & M3.
results.how_to_find_us: Downstairs at the tables along the wall (by the restroom)
results.name: Vibe with #TheShed - An Open Music Jam Session @ Silvana - Free to Attend!

results.description:
Come and have a great time enjoy a great workout with great people while potentially  getting a fantastic sunrise! :)  Check out the photos of prior sunrise hikes !!

Please adhere to the two golden rules!

 1) Hike Safe

2) Have Fun  :)

Directions From NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.


Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip


The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.
results.name: Beacon Fire Tower Morning Workout Hike   SUNRISE

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

At this month's "Business Breakthroughs" networking event, author Jamie Sussel Turner will show you how to get more comfortable and confident communicating with your team in giving and receiving feedback. 

You’ll leave with tools you can use that’ll have feedback working for you…to grow your business, your team, and a loyal customer base…while reducing your stress and aggravation!  

You’ll learn how to: 

• Invite even the most critical feedback and discover the secret to hearing it without defensiveness

• Give feedback with the right tone, timing, and intention so someone has the best chance of hearing it

• The one question to ask when inviting feedback from customers

• Create a culture of trust and openness throughout your business 

In a nutshell, when your team and customers open up to you, your stress melts away and your bottom line flourishes because you'll know exactly how to make the RIGHT decisions with the feedback you're getting.

results.description:
Registration is free: www.bknation.org/nationalconference

Monday, April 13, 2015, NEW YORK CITY—Deeply concerned by the state of America, Newark, New Jersey Mayor Ras Baraka and BK Nation’s Kevin Powell are convening BK Nation: A National Conference on Leadership, Ideas, & Action Steps, Thursday, October 8-Saturday, October 10, 2015, in Downtown Newark, in partnership with Rutgers University and the New Jersey Performing Arts Center. 
  Says Powell, “We are calling for a people’s movement in America, one that is progressive, multicultural, and inclusive of every citizen and every community that desires real change. This is why Mayor Baraka and I are asking leaders, educators, organizers, producers, innovators, doers, and influencers in politics and activism, technology and social media, the arts and entertainment, sports, the faith communities, the health, wellness, and fitness arena, and corporate America to come to Newark for this national gathering of America’s best minds, especially the younger generations: Generation X and the millennials. We will assemble, United Nations-style, not just to talk, but to exchange ideas and models of success, and action steps that are working and needed in local communities across America. We aim to build and create a 21st century brand of social change, where the people come first and their voices are heard.”
  Says Mayor Baraka: "The entire city of Newark is privileged and honored to host the BK Nation national conference. The decision to bring this important 3-day event to Newark is recognition of our groundbreaking initiatives and intense work to fundamentally transform our community. This conference will unite leaders and activists from across the nation to find solutions to the chronic and acute problems and crises that we face as a people and society, in a vast range of fields. It will also put a spotlight on the programs we have created—our Town Halls, our Model Neighborhood Initiative, our Centers of Hope, which are setting a standard and example for the entire nation. With unity and love, with compassion and commitment, this conference will put forward the agenda and solutions we need to transform America into a nation we can all believe in.”
  As America nears the end of the Obama era and a new presidential election in 2016 it has become clear that there is much to do to create freedom, justice, and equality for all people. In spite of President Obama’s historic victory in 2008 with the help of a progressive and multicultural army, there remains, in our America, deep racial divisions and violence, violence against women and girls and gender inequities, and discrimination against people because of their faith or religious beliefs, their ability or disability, their sexual identities, and because they are poor or otherwise struggling to make it financially.
  Thought leaders of all stripes have been particularly alarmed by the explosion of conflict between police and communities, by the number of Black males who’ve been shot and killed by law enforcement, by the ever-growing prison-industrial complex, by the reckless disregard for our environment, for food justice for every community, by the many health disparities, by the random use of guns that have decimated both impoverished inner cities and affluent suburbs.
  The national gathering will be free but each participant must register and cover their own expenses around travel, food, and lodging. The conference will conclude with a cultural festival at the New Jersey Performing Arts Center Saturday evening, Oct. 10th, featuring live music, live visual art, dance, short films, fashion displays, comedy, dramatic monologues, and poetry. Otherwise the entire conference will be held at Rutgers University, the Newark campus.
 

To learn more about the conference please visit: www.bknation.org/nationalconference

Please note the conference will feature a livestream and live tweets throughout the 3 days.
results.name: National Conference on Leadership,Ideas & Action Steps: Kevin Powell&Ras Baraka

2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursdays of each month (except when there is a holiday) from 8:15-9:30AM we conduct our presentations, networking and business development meetings for entrepreneurs, consultants, salespeople and business owners in the NY Tri-state area. One catch – YOU bring your own coffee :-) (I will bring the bagels.)

Schedule for 2015 @AXA: 8:15-9:30AM
Thursdays @AXA, Citrin Cooperman and Ainsworth Park Oct 8 & Lunch, 15 & Happy Hr, 22
Nov 12 & Lunch, 19 & Happy Hr, 26 is Thanksgiving (no mtg)
Dec 10 & Lunch, 17 & Happy Hr, 24

We are much more than your average meetup group. We act as your own private business advisory council and potential funding pool. Members and attendees walk out each week with sound business advice, decades worth of experience, leads and introductions.

What is an entrepreneurs breakfast /business networking and development meeting? A meeting where you present your demo, meet various people from various industries and walk out with introductions, leads and referrals and business cards. Curious how do we do this? Come on down and find out...

AXA Advisors is located at: 1290 Ave of the Americas (bet 51 - 52nd St.)
16th floor (Always check with security)

Please email or call Raphi Salem if you are interested in joining.

We charge $20.00 for all meetings (via paypal or $25 at the door) unless you become a member at $500/year. (Your first meeting is free if you just want to check it out). Please bring business cards and your own coffee. ($20 payment here through paypal: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA)

results.description:
I have been volunteering with Diane at Saint Marks Episcopal Church Community Outreach Center where they serve breakfast and lunch every day to people in need and also distribute food to them. On the second Thursday of each month they get a large shipment from the USDA/SFPP that needs to be unloaded, sorted and then distributed to the people when they come. The unloading and sorting takes place from 9am to 1pm and then from 1- 6pm they need people to stay at stations as a family comes through to select their items to take home to re-stock their pantries. I plan to go at 9am and will stay as long as I can.

You can come any time during this 9am-6pm  time frame and stay at little or as long as you can, they will appreciate any amount of time that you give. They also will appreciate if you bring any grocery bags for the people to use to carry things home. Please call the center if you have further questions[masked] and like their facebook page for updates too:

https://www.facebook.com/SaintMarksKeansburg

Come out and make a difference!  Hope to see YOU there! 


Love, Cassie

*note* if you can lift go to this anytime from 9am to noon, if you can not lift then go to this anytime from 1pm to 6pm to pass out food and clean up. I am going at 1pm

venue.name: Saint Marks Episcopal Church Community Center

results.description:
I have been volunteering with Diane at Saint Marks Episcopal Church Community Outreach Center where they serve breakfast and lunch every day to people in need and also distribute food to them. On the second Thursday of each month they get a large shipment from the USDA/SFPP that needs to be unloaded, sorted and then distributed to the people when they come. The unloading and sorting takes place from 9am to 1pm and then from 1- 6pm they need people to stay at stations to pass our the food to the families as they come in to re-stock their pantries. I plan to go at 9am and will stay as long as I can.


You can come any time during this 9am-6pm  time frame and stay at little or as long as you can, they will appreciate any amount of time that you give. They also will appreciate if you bring any grocery bags for the people to use to carry things home. Please call the center if you have further questions[masked] and like their facebook page for updates too:

https://www.facebook.com/SaintMarksKeansburg

Come out and make a difference!    Hope to see YOU there! 


Love, Cassie


*note* if you can lift go to this anytime from 9am to noon, if you can not lift then go to this anytime from 1pm to 6pm to pass out food and clean up. I am going at 1pm
results.how_to_find_us: the center is the tan building next to the church
results.name: Volunteers Needed for USDA Pantry Day

results.description:
NYPH is happy to share this BEEx and MechoSystems event. 

Please register here on the BEEx website. Are you going? RSVP on the NYPH Meetup Page and let us know!

Understanding the metrics of daylight performance is crucial to the design and operation of any lighting system that hopes to integrate daylight. In 2013, the Illuminating Engineering Society approved a method to calculate a new set of climate-based daylight metrics to evaluate daylit spaces: Spatial Daylight Autonomy and Annual Sun Penetration. This method has been adopted in LEED v4.0 and is expected to be utilized by other consensus-based codes and standards that promote better daylit spaces. 


These metrics, based on research and occupant/expert assessments for real spaces, provide designers a tool to more effectively describe, evaluate, and improve the performance of their daylighting designs. 

Attendees will:

• Understand how the IES climate-based daylight metrics were developed

• Know how to use Spatial Daylight Autonomy and Annual Sun Penetration metrics during design

• Learn about different software tools to calculate metrics

• Learn about several successful applications of the metric

SPEAKERS
Mudit Saxena, Principal, Vistar Energy Consulting
Jack Bailey, Partner, ONELUXStudio

Mudit Saxena of Vistar Energy Consulting and Jack Bailey of ONELUXStudio will discuss their experience on utilizing and calculating daylight metrics to design effective lighting systems. Mr. Saxena is an internationally recognized expert in daylighting and lighting research, and his work has led to the development of various building energy codes and standards. Mr. Bailey is an industry-leading lighting designer and is involved in drafting the new International Green Construction Code. 



Please register here on the BEEx website. Are you going? RSVP on the NYPH Meetup Page and let us know!
results.name: Daylight Metrics: The What, How, and Why Should I Care (A BEEx Event)

results.description:
NYPH is happy to share this upcoming NYSERDA workshop!

Register here with NYSERDA directly

If you're going, let us know here on the NYPH Meetup page too! 

Attend this FREE workshop to learn about net zero energy performance, best practices, design options, and energy modeling considerations. Also hear about the support available through <a>NYSERDA's Low-rise Residential New Construction Program!</a>

For details regarding AIA or other continuing education credits available for attending this workshop, please contact Lisa Diffenback at [masked] or <a>(518)[masked]</a>. 

Scheduled as 4 modules - attend one session or all four

9:30am to 10:00am Module 1: Performance Criteria and Thresholds - Discuss common measures and best practices used in designing net zero projects.

10:00am to 12:45pm Module 2: Design - Discuss common measures and best practices used in designing net zero projects.

1:15pm to 2:15pm Module 3: Economics - Examine cost versus benefits for specific upgrades and measures, and the associated impacts on energy performance.

2:30pm to 4:00pm Module 4: REM Modeling - Explore energy modeling considerations.

Presenters:

Bob Grindrod/Michelle Tinner, CLEAResult Senior Technical Analysts
Lisa Diffenback, CLEAResult Senior Account Manager 

Registrants must present valid ID and sign in at the security desk.

Register here with NYSERDA directly

If you're going, let us know here on the NYPH Meetup page too! 


Become a NY Passive House member
Visit the NY Passive House website
Read the NY Passive House blog
Register for the NY Passive House newsletter

results.description:
RECESS Inspires is an experience for NYCs innovator class. It’s the most productive break you’ll take from your work week.

REGISTER HERE WITH DISCOUNT CODE: OSFASHION

This event is for people that understand that personal and professional growth is the product of building authentic relationships.


The Day Will Include:
Yacht Transportation To & From La Marina NYC
Yoga on A Private Beach w/ Grip The Mat
Lunch from Celebrity Chef Kelvin Fernandez
An Engaging Discussion w/ Matthew Brimer
…and all kinds of additional surprises.

General Assembly’s Co-Founder Matthew Brimer will be partaking in the entire day. He will talk to all guests about how he builds and leverages communities to grow business.


THIS IS AN INTIMATE EVENT, OPEN TO 150 PEOPLE 

Use discount code ‘OSFashion‘ while tickets are still available!  Register HERE.

—
9:30am – 10:00am Boarding Call for Cloud 9 Yacht Charter:

Guests will board our chartered yacht service at East 23rd St. & FDR Drive

10:00am – 11:10am Set Sail Around Manhattan

Cloud 9 Charters will take us to and from La Marina NYC (approximately 1 hour each way). On board, guests will enjoy live music, energizing food & drink, engaging conversations, and breathtaking views!

11:10am – 11:30am Arrive at La Marina Restaurant & Beach

La Marina offers a unique experience that infuses a touch of South Beach in Manhattan, setting the perfect backdrop for social events. The newly rebuilt restaurant, bar, & lounge covers 75,000 square feet of Hudson River waterfront.

12:00pm – 1:00pm Yoga on The Beach w/ Grip The Mat

Grip the Mat provides quality experiences where like- minded individuals come together to foster fitness, mindfulness and friendship. They encourage a balanced lifestyle by creating a space for individuals to connect, while empowering them to live more actively engaged and vibrant lives. http://gripthemat.com/

1:00pm – 2:15pm Lunch by Celebrity Chef Kelvin Fernandez

Chef Fernandez will prepare a fresh and vibrant lunch created specially for the RECESS community.

2:15pm – 3:00pm Conversation w/ Matthew Brimer

Participate in a guided conversation with Matthew Brimer, co-founder of General Assembly & the DAYBREAKER morning movement.

3:30pm – 4:30pm Sail Back to Lower Manhattan

Cloud 9 Charters will take us back to East 23rd St. Our ride back will feature a live DJ, natural smoothies and juices, plus great vibes and views!

This is personally my first Comic Con; i'm very excited to stroll down artist alley and check out the show floor on Friday.  I'd be down to try and meet up with anyone here who will be there, but I don't really even know how possible (or impossible that might be).

Andy

Join Daniel Norton OnSet for a FREE open model shoot. Adorama will be providing two fashion models, lighting and some lenses. You bring your camera, memory cards and a desire to make great images.

Daniel will set up new lighting scenario at the start of each session and attendees are free to shoot and use the images for their own portfolios and non-commercial promotion (social media etc).

90 Minute Shooting sessions start at 12pm, 2pm and 4pm. 
Come for one, come for all!

Daniel Norton is the Creative Director for Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.

results.description:
2nd Thursday of each month (except when there is a holiday) from 12:30-2PM we conduct our presentations, networking and business development meetings for entrepreneurs, consultants, salespeople and business owners in the NY Tri-state area. One catch – YOU bring your own lunch:-) (I supply the coffee.)

Schedule for 2015
Thursdays @Citrin Cooperman and Happy Hr Ainsworth Park

Oct 8 & Lunch, 15 & Happy Hr
Nov 12 & Lunch, 19 & Happy Hr
Dec 10 & Lunch, 17 & Happy Hr

We are much more than your average meetup group. We act as your own private business advisory council and potential funding pool. Members and attendees walk out each week with sound business advice, decades worth of experience, leads and introductions.

What is an entrepreneurs lunch/business networking and development meeting? A meeting where you present your demo, meet various people from various industries and walk out with introductions, leads and referrals and business cards. Curious how do we do this? Come on down and find out...

Citrin Cooperman is located at 529 Fifth Ave @44th Street (Always check in with security)

Please email or call Raphi Salem if you are interested in joining.

We charge $20.00 for all meetings (via paypal or $25 at the door) unless you become a member at $500/year. (Your first meeting is free if you just want to check it out). Please bring business cards and your own coffee. ($20 payment here through paypal: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA)

If you are interested in joining, please RSVP here. Please contact Raphi Salem at [masked] or call[masked] if you have any questions.

Thank you,
Raphi Salem
SalemGlobal Internet, Website Marketing & Lead Generation
www.SalemGlobal.com
www.RaphiSalem.com

results.description:
Are you using predictive approaches to truly leveraging customer analytics? If not, I highly recommend this webinar where we’ll review predictive analytic approaches to common customer analytics tasks such as predicting likelihood to purchase or expected near-term customer value.

Presented by: Dean Abbott, President, Abbott Analytics
Thu, Oct 8,[masked]:00 PM – 2:00 PM EDT
Register here for this free webinar on Practical Customer Analytics using Predictive Approaches

Predictive approaches include considerable data cleaning and preparation, building predictive models, and assessing the predictive models. At each stage of the process, practical tips for accomplishing these tasks will be described with specific “how to’s”. We will also discuss compromises that inevitably need to be made because of data problems and time pressures to deploy solutions to operational systems.

Mr. Abbott has over 21 years of experience applying advanced data mining, data preparation, and data visualization methods in real-world data intensive problems, including fraud detection, risk modeling, text mining, response modeling, survey analysis, planned giving, and predictive toxicology. In addition, Mr. Abbott serves as chief technology officer and mentor for start-up companies focused on applying advanced analytics in their consulting practices.

Please reserve your seat today. Space is limited. The webinar will take place on Thursday, October 8th at 1:00pm EDT. We hope you can attend, but if you sign up and can’t make it we’ll send you a link to view the deck and recording the day after the webinar.

Free Registration Here.

The NCFA is holding their next webinar on October 8 titled:

This Celiac Life: The Realities of Living with Celiac Disease

"Everyone has large and complex networks that play a role in our health, happiness, success and satisfaction in life. A person's network can be significantly impacted by a life-changing event, including the diagnosis of a chronic condition like celiac disease.

Celiac disease affects more than just the food we eat - it presents a unique set of challenges within our networks at home, work, socially and beyond. Through the exploration and understanding of our own networks, we can learn what steps to take in order to better manage celiac disease and live gluten-free.

Join the National Foundation for Celiac Awareness (NFCA) as Glenna Crooks, PhD, founder of SageMyLife, takes you through one individual's journey before and after a celiac disease diagnosis and dives into the many ways that a celiac disease diagnosis can impact the relationships with those around us."

results.description:
This Celiac Life: The Realities of Living with Celiac Disease

Everyone has large and complex networks that play a role in our health, happiness, success and satisfaction in life. A person's network can be significantly impacted by a life-changing event, including the diagnosis of a chronic condition like celiac disease.

Celiac disease affects more than just the food we eat - it presents a unique set of challenges within our networks at home, work, socially and beyond. Through the exploration and understanding of our own networks, we can learn what steps to take in order to better manage celiac disease and live gluten-free.


Join the National Foundation for Celiac Awareness (NFCA) as Glenna Crooks, PhD, founder of SageMyLife, takes you through one individual's journey before and after a celiac disease diagnosis and dives into the many ways that a celiac disease diagnosis can impact the relationships with those around us.


You must pre-register for this event: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/7597758757325341442

This event takes place on your personal computer! 

About the Panelist

Glenna Crooks, Ph.D., as Founder of SageLife, LLC, created and will soon launch new ways to visualize, understand and transform networks to help people and organizations improve health, happiness, satisfaction and success.


Previously, as Founder and President of Strategic Health Policy International, Inc. she solved tough health care problems and was known as a “one-woman think tank” by business and government clients globally. Since her time as an Appointee of President Ronald Reagan, she has been in demand as a keynote speaker and as confidential counsel to senior business and government leaders, who respect her for the wisdom and candor she offers about the dilemmas they face.

During Merck&Co, Inc.’s Most Admired Corporation years, her policy group was recognized as the best in the Fortune 500. She received the Congressional Exemplary Service Award for Orphan Products Development and was the first civilian to receive the highest award in public health, theSurgeon General’s Medallion from C. Everett Koop. Her innovations earned her recognition as aDisruptive Woman in Health Care.

She a Fellow of the University of Pennsylvania Center for Neuroscience and Society, serves on corporate and non-profit Boards and is the author of several books, among them Covenants:Inspiring the Soul of Healing and The Network Sage, which will be published later this year.

results.description:
Find your inner peace in the mist of chaotic city life. We experience stressful and painful things in our lives, these things sure are difficult, beneath the tears and hurt, there still remains peace and love inside us. If you are looking to get better, or find balances in your life, come join this meetup and let your inner peace take over, you will be amazed.


This Thursday, we will be having a meditation/relaxation session by listening to a type of traditional music originated from rural part of eastern China, which is mellow, melodious yet very emotive and powerful. Just close your eyes and let your mind flow with these beautiful ancient melodies, get in the zone, let go of those emotional tensions that have been bottling up, cry a little if you feel like to.

The meditation/relaxation session starts with 15 minutes of guided meditation, then 20 minutes of music, after that we spend approx 45minutes or so introducing ourselves to each other, discussing and sharing difficulties or happiness in our lives if you choose to. We spend the last 15-20 minutes relaxing to the music again.


Cost:  First timers: Free


Repeaters: $10 (cash) to cover group incurred expenses and organizing fees,  will be collected at the meeting.

Guidelines:

Please arrive 10-15 minutes early, we will promptly start at 5pm,  door will be closed to prevent disturbance once the meditation is in session.

We meet in the downstairs conference room, if you can't find it simply ask a front desk person where the Meditation Group Meeting is as you enter the library.

Bring your own water to drink.

Bring your own yoga mat if you wish to sit on the floor, or there are chairs in the room you can sit on.

Please RSVP responsibly, only sign up for this meetup if you have a true intention to attend and be on time.  If you must cancel, please kindly hit the "change" button switch to "no", so other people on the waitlist can move up.
results.name: Self Healing Circle and Guided Meditation/Relaxatio­n Therapy with Music

results.description:
Going to try and make this weekly until the snow comes:

Any one interested in some speed (track) workout during the week? I usually try and get to Berkeley Heights high school once a week. Dates flexible if more interested.


Going to bump this up to some 1200 meter repeats this week.  

10-15 minute warmup with dynamic movement

4 x 1200m at 10k pace.  2 min recovery between rep

10 min cool down

Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could happen as you willingly run across rough terrain with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/
results.name: Berkeley Heights Track Workout- Round 3

results.description:
Join DM Kyle Wagenblast as he recreates the classic D&D 2E module "Adam's Wrath" by Lisa Smedman. This is an adventure in the Ravenloft setting, updated to D&D 5E, and is for characters of 5th level.

In the domain of Lamordia, Doctor Victor Mordenheim created Adam, cobbling the creature together from parts of human corpses. Now, years later, Adam wants revenge. Adam wants Elise, Victor's wife. Adam wants Victor dead.

The players' ship founders on the coast of the domain of Lamordia. A vicious storm leaves them washed ashore, cold and hungry on the ice-bound Isle of Agony... then, the terror begins.
results.name: D&D 5E: Ravenloft - Adam's Wrath

We play 7V7

Please do note apply if you are not currently working for one of the on-demand/sharing/gig platforms

Pizza and soft drinks will be served

results.description:
Please read class descriptions carefully before you sign up. 

*If you are unsure about which class is appropriate for you- not to worry; I will let you know after I hear your evaluation.


Foreign Accent Reduction: Class 1

This class is for speakers of English as a second language who wish to:

• Improve pronunciation of Standard American English consonants and vowels.  

•  Learn the basic intonation and stress patterns of English. Use sound linking strategies to improve fluency.

•  Decrease misunderstandings by learning key strategies for effective communication. 

• Gain practice by speaking within a group. Increase confidence in both social and professional speech.

**Prior to the class beginning, each participant will take an evaluation and meet for a 60- minute 1:1 session, either in person or via Skype to discuss your speech and goals for the program. Individual attention is provided to each group member (maximum 5 learners) throughout the class, as is custom-made material with your target sounds and issues.

Classes will meet 6 times (12 hours of instruction), on the following dates:

Tuesday, October 13

Tuesday, October 20

Tuesday, October 27

Tuesday November 3

Tuesday, November 10

*Thursday November 19

Classes will meet from 6:00-8:00 at: 

133 West 25th Street, #7E in Chelsea, between 6th and 7th Avenues

The price for the class, including pre-assessment and materials is $660. 

Payment by check or cash at the evaluation meeting. 

Make appointment to register and record pretest no later than October 5, 2015.

This class is not intended for speakers with very light accents. Class 2 is designed for more advanced speakers of English who wish to pollish their existing skills, and will be available soon. Contact me if you have any questions regarding suitability for either class.

Foreign Accent Reduction: Class 2

This class is for mastering additional techniques for improving English pronunciation. In class 2, you will:

Fine-tune your pronunciation skills. 

Expand on your understanding and use of complex English sounds and patterns. 

Address complex linking and intonation issues so that your communication is smooth and natural-sounding. 

Improve your confidence and proficiency through engaging activities, such as reading aloud, conversation, role play, and short presentations. 

Receive individual attention. Hear the difference in your speech and incorporate it into your everyday life!

Classes will meet 6 times (12 hours of instruction), on the following dates:

Thursdays:

 October 8, 15, 22, 29 and November 5, 12

Classes will meet from 6:00-8:00 at:

133 West 25th St, #7E

In Chelsea, between 6th and 7th Avenues

If you have not had a prior speech evaluation, you will need to schedule one before October 1. (see Class 1**).

The price for the class, including personalized materials and evaluation (if not taken prior to class) is $660.

Payment by check or cash at the evaluation meeting.

results.description:
RSVP's through Meetup are now closed but we'll have cash tickets on the door at $10

---------------------------------------------------------


Hi Everyone,

Please join us for our October FinTech Shark Tank.

The format of this event is the familiar Shark vs Entrepreneur pitch. Each Entrepreneur gets to pitch to our Sharks who each have $1Million in virtual money to invest, whoever gets the greatest total investment wins the event.

If you're a seed stage FinTech company looking for funding then you will definitely want to pitch at this event. The event is open to all seed stage FinTech companies, please drop one of the Organisers a line if you'd like a slot.

                                                  Agenda

Please be aware that the agenda is updated on a regular basis

6:00pm - Doors open

Refreshments and networking opportunities

7:00pm - Session starts

-> Welcome address 

Ashish Singal, NewFinance New York Chapter Organiser

--> Shark Tank 

Sharks:

1. Alex Tarhini, who manages the Techstars Fintech Accelerator in NYC 

2. Jeff Seltzer is the managing partner of Pierce Yates Ventures which provides early stage funding and advice to emerging companies in the financial services and sports verticals. He is a member of the board of directors of New York Angels


3. Meghan Cross, Managing Director of Red Bear Angels, the new angel group that invests in early-stage ventures founded or led by Cornell University alumni


Entrepreneurs:

1. Scott Weiner, Founder of ClosingBell, a data-driven crowdsourced equity research platform


2. Kumesh Aroomoogan, Co-Founder and CEO of Accern, the world's first big data analytics factory where companies can seamlessly extract insights from any textual data


3. Charlie Strout, CEO of Prudena Inc., value investing re-imaging.  At Prudena Inc., we provide busy value investors with research, tools, community and a professional investment process that combine to lower stress and raise returns

4. Rishi Singh, Founder of Tiingo.com - Making high-end financial tools accessible to everyone


5. Sahil Shah & Janahan Sivaraman, Co-Founders, Quotail lets you follow the money in the options market


6. Jack Slocum, Founder and CEO of alta5, Crowdsourced Robo-trading


8:00pm - Closing

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

Just a little more business...

THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE

results.description:
Join the conversation: http://slack.cdnyc.co

</a>

-------------------------------------------------- 

Sign-in & networking at 6:15, talks at 6:45. 

--------------------------------------------------  

SYNOPSIS

80% of software failures are only caused by about 20% of problem patterns. If we have to deliver more releases faster, we can take this to our advantage by finding these 20% earlier in the pipeline. In this talk, Andreas will give 4 real life scenarios on why software deployments failed, looks at the application quality metrics (# of SQL executions, Memory Usage, Pool Configuration and Usage, Service Interactions ...) and discusses how to automate detecting these problems earlier in your build pipeline.

--------------------------------------------------

BIO

<a href="https://twitter.com/xebialabs">Andreas Grabner is a performance advocate who has been working in this field for the past fifteen years. Andreas helps organizations identify the real problems in their Java, .NET, PHP, Web and Mobile applications and then uses this knowledge to teach others how to avoid the problems by sharing engineering best practices. 

--------------------------------------------------

SPONSOR

This event is hosted by Betterment.

Betterment is a hands-off automated investing service for long term savings goals with a personalized, globally diversified portfolio. Betterment has the lowest fees in the industry, and eliminates the typical complexities of investments (like rebalancing and dividend reinvesting), all while optimizing for taxes at a lower cost.
results.name: Shift-Left Quality: Building App Quality Metric Gateways into Your Pipeline

results.description:
Pre-Dive Orientation and Academic Review

This is a REQUIRED session for anyone planning on doing the certification dives this weekend.

• We will review your SDI Academics. 

• Equipment Requirements

• Dive Planning

Get here extra early to pick up any required or additional equipment you might need for the dives. You should review the equipment checklist.

Finally! Certification Dives are just a few days away.

Before getting certified every diver must come in and review their completed academics with the instructor.

Bring your:

• Completed Final exam

• Skills Checklist

•  Basic OW planner (print from website)

• Introduction to Dive Computers


Using Dive Computers

To help familiarize you with how Underwater Dive Computers work, use the following links: Introduction to Dive Computers. (There is a nominal fee) Using an Underwater computer is one of the safest ways to dive today. Computers are relatively inexpensive and very reliable. Putting the tools you need to complete a safe and fun dive right in your hand. Enroll and complete online course,  when finished printout and bring us the results/certificate. Introduction to Dive Computers

</a>

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/pdfs/whybuymyown.pdf">Why Buy My Own Equipment? Diving more than most other sports requires reliable equipment and instruction on its proper use. Don’t listen to an inexperienced expert or be fooled by the online hype, you get the best gear right here, from the people you can trust.

EQUIPMENT: You are responsible for having all the gear you need to dive this weekend. Arrange equipment rentals with the shop.and pick up any rental equipment you will need. You will be wearing a thicker wetsuit, which you must try on to ensure proper fit. Purchasing Neoprene gloves is also highly recommended. Scuba Gear required for Certification Dives.

Additionally you will need

SDI Logbook

Planning Slate

Equipment requirements for Certification Dives

Wetsuit (6mm or 7mm)

Hood

Weights and weight belt

BCD (Buoyancy Compensator Device)

Regulator

Dive Computer 

SCUBA Cylinder

You should reserve your equipment in advance and pick it up before the weekend. You are responsible for transporting all the equipment needed to complete your certification dives.

Call us with any questions. [masked]

Print out a few copies of the dive planner to bring with you tonight. Basic OW planner

results.description:
Max Tudor has adapted well to his post as vicar of St Edwold's in the idyllic village of Nether Monkslip. The quiet village seems the perfect home for Max, who has fled a harrowing past as an MI5 agent. Now he has sound a measure of peace among urban escapees and yoga practitioners, artists and crafters and New Agers. But this new-found serenity is quickly shattered when the highly vocal and unpopular president of the Women's Institute turns up dead at the Harvest Fayre. The death looks like an accident but Max's training as a former agent kicks in, and before long he suspects foul play...

In Wicked Autumn, G M Malliet serves up an irresistible English village - deliciously skewered - a flawed but engaging protagonist and a brilliantly modern version of the traditional locked room mystery (Goodreads)

This series of Dinner & Politics will be an evening filled with a chock-full of foreign affairs topics.  We'll discuss the following three contentious topics that unfolded recently:


I. China:  President Xi Jinping's recent visit to the U.S., amid China's economic downturn and the devaluation of its currency.  More importantly, how this official State visit impacts the ever-increasingly complex nature of the U.S.-China relationship.


II. Iran: the latest developments in the Nuclear Deal.


III.  Vatican: the recent Papal visit and the Vatican's  historic role in its attempt to shape and influence the U.S. public policies.

PLUS, if time permits, we'll also discuss the latest military escalations in Syria.


---------------------------------------------------

How the RSVP works:

The RSVP window will open on Saturday,  October 3rd at noon -- it is managed this way for fairness.  The discussions are intended to be among a small group of approximately ten to twelve members.  In order to attend, your RSVP status must be a confirmed "YES" -- being on a wait list is not a confirmed "YES" RSVP.  Several members from a foreign policy group will be joining us for this one.


---------------------------------------------------


We'll be gathering at a large table on the mezzanine level, as shown in the photo below.
results.name: Dinner & Politics: China's economy, the Iran nuclear deal & recent Papal visit

results.description:
Big Data in the Big Apple
presented by
Minerva Tantoco, Chief Technology Officer for the City of New York
and
Dr. Amen Ra Mashariki, Chief Analytics Officer for the City of New York

Free beer, drinks & candy PLUS free Selfie-Sticks, 4gb USB keys & more swag courtesy of ClustrixDB!

RSVP at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/225811781/

A Database Month event: http://www.DatabaseMonth.com/database/nyc-cto

The NYC CTO and Mayor's Office of Data Analytics will discuss the NYC technology ecosystem, explain how each of their relatively new offices operate, talk about how data impacts their work, and present opportunities for engagement with the data community.

Minerva Tantoco is New York City's first-ever Chief Technology Officer (CTO). As CTO, Tantoco directs the Mayor's Office of Technology and Innovation with responsibility for the development and implementation of a coordinated citywide strategy on technology and innovation and encouraging collaboration across agencies and with the wider New York City technology ecosystem.

For more than 25 years - from launching her own start-up to directing technology and innovation for large enterprises - Tantoco has worked to affect business transformation across a range of industries from advertising to finance. results.description:
Join us in Central Park for a great workout! We will be doing a mix of high intensity exercises including sprints, jumps, and others combined with awesome equipment to make the workout challenging and fun. The workout will be taking place on the Great Lawn or a near by open area of grass. 

We will be meeting at the King Jagiello statue, you can find the location through the links below. Please arrive a few minutes before 6:30pm. 

I will be there with a big blue camping backpack, just look for me and come say hello. If you arrive after 6:30pm and I am not there, come find us on the lawn. Wear sneakers, workout clothes, and bring water for yourself. 

The fall is here and the sun is setting earlier so to do workouts around this time, some light will be needed to see easier. This group is based on the outdoors so I suggest picking up a headlamp to use during the workout. A headlamp is an essential piece of gear during any hiking / camping trip (such as the trips we run to the Amazon Rainforest) so this will give you the opportunity to practice using one. If you have any questions, message me. 

http://www.centralparknyc.org/things-to-see-and-do/attractions/king-jagiello.html

Location on a map: 

http://www.centralparknyc.org/maps/index.html?attraction=506618777

This is a free workout organized by Tamandua Expeditions (http://tamanduajungle.com/). See you out there!
results.name: Central Park Adventure Workout

results.description:
Thank you for your interest in our group.

 We have created a phenomenal culture providing Real Estate Education and then providing a network of like minded Real Estate Investors connecting with each other.

At our meetup you will have an opportunity to learn  how Real Estate Investors think and to understand the strategies that they use.  You will meet other active Real Estate Investors.  We will talk about  those different strategies of Investing and also talk about the Deals we have actively done.  


Additionally we will talk about Business Development within Real Estate Investing, Tax & Legal Strategies, Investing w/Retirement Savings and so much more....

If you would like to come to one of our meetings please e-mail me with your:

      FULL  NAME,  E-MAIL  ADDRESS  &  MOBILE  NUMBER

(info needed for registration)

Thank you,

Mary J. & George A. Papadopoulos

Real Estate Opportunites

results.name: Learn about Real Estate Investing

group.name: New York Real Estate Investing Meetup

results.description:
Would you like to meet a group of local successful Real Estate investors who are reaping the benefits of a once in a life time buyers market?

At this meeting we will discuss why there are more millionaires created through real estate than all other industries combined. Right now we're in a once in a lifetime Real Estate buyers market which is helping to fuel our expansion. The combination of record low mortgage rates and underpriced housing values is why our group is making a killing in this market. Even the "world's greatest Investor" Warren Buffet is advising people to buy real estate.

You will have the opportunity to:

*Network with a group of successful Real Estate Investors.

*Learn how rental properties are one of the best tax saving strategies out there.

*Discuss the biggest money making opportunities in today's market: Short Sales, Lease Options, Fix and Flips, Foreclosures, Seller Financed Notes, Multi-Family Dwellings and much more.

*Learn how to be your own boss.

*Find out how you can earn while you learn Real Estate

Investing.

*Learn how to build massive wealth with strategies such as Fix

and Flips and passive wealth with rental properties.

*And so much more.

Each meeting is different as we will show you different deals we've completed recently. We will also show you how you can be included in the deals we have going forward. 

Some of our members invest part time for residual income while others have been able to FIRE THEIR BOSS to invest full time. If you are interested in learning how to make consistent $30,000 or more per deal please RSVP. We have a wide network of Real Estate Investors local to the NY Metro Area that will show you how.

PLEASE ANSWER RSVP QUESTIONS TO RECEIVE ADDRESS!
results.name: Free Real Estate Investing Workshop

results.description:
Come and meet our community of local real estate investors, build your network, and learn why real estate is IDEAL and why you should be involved with our community of real estate investors. We constantly learn & earn together and have fun together. Within our real estate investing community, we train people with no experience to people who have been working in the real estate field for many years. So it's not important what experience you have! Working with our community, you will learn in depth knowledge of how real estate investing strategies work and you will also develop yourself to be a successful real estate entrepreneur.

At this meeting we talk about the biggest money making opportunities (Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy & Holds, Seller Financed Notes + Tax Liens/Deeds, Multi-Family/Commercial and Money Lending) for a Real Estate Investor in today’s market. You will get to learn about new investors that are investing in real estate and making $10,000-$100,000+ per real estate transaction, we will also talk about how you can make $1,000-$10,000 commissions helping our community grow and you will learn working strategies from professional and practicing Real Estate Investors on how to create wealth through real estate investing.. This way you can learn & earn, get educated so you can invest in real estate, enjoy your life and pass your wealth on to future generations. Because we will cover a LOT of things in a short amount of time such as saving money on taxes, investment opportunities and other ways to make money working with our team, only those who attend the orientation will get invited to private follow up meetings to cover more in depth advanced strategies and working with our community.

To attend, simply RSVP & answer the registration questions for location! If you would like to bring a friend or business partner with you to the meeting, please email us their name, email address and phone number so that we can make sure they are registered for the meeting.
results.name: Learn About Our Real Estate Investing Community, Training & Income Opportunity!

group.name: The NYC Real Estate Investors Success Meetup Group

results.description:
Fortune Magazine projects that between 2006 and[masked],000 Millionaires will be Created through Real Estate Investing because of the recession. It is our Mission to bring that prediction to Fruition. Will you be one of those Millionaires?

######For the MEETING ADDRESS you MUST RSVP with your FULL NAME, EMAIL ADDRESS, and BEST PHONE #.

We offer Free Meetings, and Real Estate Investing Training CLASSES that cost, and have helped people transition from Wanting to invest, to BECOMING Real Estate Investors. From an investor that is only making a little extra money and still working for someone else, to a SUCCESSFUL Real Estate Investor who is in charge of how much he or she makes and has the option to never work for anyone else ever again. Gain a team of Investors, Real Estate Agents, Tax & Legal Professionals, Contractors and more, to really get your Business Started!

On THURSDAY we will discuss:

•  Our Recent Deals, and the steps we took to Complete them

•  Tax Write Offs and Creative Ways to Acquire Properties

•  Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy and Holds, and more

We will:

•  Help you figure out how many properties You Personally Need to Acquire to Reach your Financial Goal

•  Discuss how you can be apart of our future Deals

•  Give you the opportunity to Network and share in the stories of New Investors and Seasoned Investors

•  And much, much more

RSVP TO RECEIVE THE MEETING ADDRESS, FOR THIS THURSDAY AT 6:30PM!

“The critical ingredient is Getting off your Butt and Doing Something. It’s as simple as that. A lot of people have Ideas, but there are a Few who decide to Do Something about them Now. Not tomorrow. Not next week. But Today. The true Entrepreneur is a doer, not a dreamer.” – Noel Bushnell, Entrepreneur

“The Way to Get Started is to Quit talking and Begin Doing”  – Walt Disney, co-founder of the Walt Disney Company

Join us at our next meeting by emailing us at [masked] to help our two writers on deck to workshop their scripts. You'll perform their pages in front of the group and then everyone is welcome to give the writer feedback. (Members are also welcome to just observe, and not act, if they prefer!)

We coordinate our casts through email, and not MeetUp, so be sure to email us if you want to be cast in a role.

Please view our website to sign up or for more info: www.TheWagNY.com

The NYC CTO and Mayor's Office of Data Analytics will discuss the NYC technology ecosystem, explain how each of their relatively new offices operate, talk about how data impacts their work, and present opportunities for engagement with the data community.

Minerva Tantoco is New York City's first-ever Chief Technology Officer (CTO). As CTO, Tantoco directs the Mayor's Office of Technology and Innovation with responsibility for the development and implementation of a coordinated citywide strategy on technology and innovation and encouraging collaboration across agencies and with the wider New York City technology ecosystem.

For more than 25 years - from launching her own start-up to directing technology and innovation for large enterprises - Tantoco has worked to affect business transformation across a range of industries from advertising to finance. With her appointment to the administration of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, she brings this wealth of experience in technology-enabled transformation to government.

Raised in Flushing, Queens, Tantoco is a product of New York City public schools. She attended Bronx Science High School and while still in college, moved to Silicon Valley where she co-founded technology startup, Manageware Inc, which was successfully sold five years later. Since then, Ms. Tantoco has led emerging technology initiatives including artificial intelligence, e-commerce, virtualization, online marketing and mobile applications.

Ms. Tantoco holds four US patents on intelligent workflow and is a speaker and author on mobile, security, big data, and innovation. As Senior Product Manager at Palm, Tantoco pioneered mobile enterprise solutions in the early 2000s which helped pave the path in mobile technology, developing and deploying some of the world's earliest mobile applications.

As Chief Architect at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Tantoco led the re-design and implementation of the company's Investment Banking data warehouse, a project that mirrors many of the City's big data and analytics initiatives. Ms. Tantoco most recently served as UBS APAC CTO for client-facing technology and innovation, with regional responsibility for the Asia Pacific region.

Dr. Amen Ra Mashariki is the City's Chief Analytics Officer and leads the Mayor's Office of Data Analytics (MODA). Dr. Mashariki is an accomplished leader within government, private sector and academia with experience in bringing Big Data processing and analytics for large and complex data management efforts. He started his professional careers as a software engineer at Motorola working on over-the-air data transmission projects and led a team of user-interface developers to build components of security features for handheld devices. Most recently, Dr. Mashariki served as Chief Technology Officer at the U.S. Office of Personnel Management.

Dr. Mashariki previously worked at the Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Lab as a computer scientist and research scientist where he led a team working on data mining and data fusion projects in the bioinformatics domain. Prior to that, he served as Assistant Director of Informatics at the University of Chicago Comprehensive Cancer Research Center and taught computer science courses at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, and robotics at Northwestern University.

Dr. Mashariki holds a Doctor of Engineering from Morgan State University, a Master of Science in Computer Science from Howard University, and a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from Lincoln University. Amen is a Brooklyn native and attended Brooklyn Tech High School.

results.description: Our second reading for the Greek Book Club will be Middlesex, the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel that tells the story of three generations of Greeks. The story spans from Smyrna to Detroit, and focuses on Cal, whose fate was sealed by the pivotal decision made by his grandparents as they fled for their lives from Asia Minor. The book has 4 parts, and for this next meeting we will read the first two. Middlesex is available as an eBook, and there are several copies available in local libraries, though those are often unavailable because the book remains very popular 13 years after its publication date. Several online used booksellers have inexpensive copies available too.
results.name: Greek Book Club: Middlesex, by Jeffrey Eugenides

Specials for our meetup:

The Cliffs at LIC features:

results.description:
In this class we will learn how to build a financial model (i.e the income statement) for your business. 

1. What information the financial model can give you and why it is necessary to build it, though much of it is a guess.


2. Income Statement Basics: Income statement structure, the meaning of different line items, and an overview of important ratios that measure operational and financial health of the company.


3. Modeling your business: We will start with a template and each of you will adopt it to your business. 

4. Revenues and Costs: We will discuss how to model different revenue streams, and estimate relevant fixed and variable costs.


5. Assumptions / Revenue and Cost drivers: The crux of the modeling is an ability to make good assumptions. Anyone can build a mathematical formula and propagate it forward, but the output is only as good as the inputs. We will explore how to make assumptions that are justifiable and achievable, what research needs to be done in order to figure out what those assumptions need to be and what strategic decisions you need to make in order to set stage for how those assumptions, such as growth rates, will evolve. 

6. Break-even analysis - i.e identifying the point in time at which your business becomes profitable.


7. We will also discuss what aspects of your financial model are important to investors and why.

Please send a $25 payment  to [masked] via PayPal by October 7th or pay $30 at the door or same day.

--------------------------------------------------------

About Victoria Yampolsky, CFA:

Victoria Yampolsky, CFA, is the President of the Startup Station, a finance & strategy consultancy for startups and small/mid-size businesses. She is also an advisor to Mobilosophy, Divvy Tools, and Plan to Start, as well as founder of several ventures in media & entertainment. Previously, Victoria worked in Deutsche Bank Research and did IT consulting for CapGemini's Financial Services Division.
results.name: Financial Model for Your Business - Bring your Laptop

results.description:
Daniel Walsh

-on-

How to make Containers actually Contain? Docker, SELinux and Coloring Books.

Note: WE ARE MEETING AT CIVIC HALL!! We'll need names, and you will need IDs. RSVP will open Thurs Sept 24th, 2015, 4:30pm.

As container use gains popularity, container security is more important than ever. This talk is split into 4 parts detailing security measures in containers, signing, authentication and authorization with the daemon, and mandatory access control.

In this session, you will:

- Learn about the security measures in container management that control what processes within a container can do, and hear about upcoming security enhancements to containers.
- See how container images are signed.
- Discover authentication updates being made to the server to control who’s able to manipulate a container, and learn how developers are splitting functions that an authenticated user is allowed to do on the server.
- Learn how SELinux works and how it works with Docker.

Afterwards:
Join us afterwards at The Storehouse Pub where we'll continue the discussion over drinks and/or food. The Storehouse Pub is located at 69 W. 23rd Street.

Speaker Bio:

Daniel Walsh has worked in the computer security field for over 30 years. Dan joined Red Hat in August 2001. Dan leads the RHEL Docker enablement team since August 2013, but has been working on container technology for several years. He has led the SELinux project, concentrating on the application space and policy development. Dan helped developed sVirt, Secure Vitrualization. He also created the SELinux Sandbox, the Xguest user and the Secure Kiosk. Previously, Dan worked Netect/Bindview's on Vulnerability Assessment Products and at Digital Equipment Corporation working on the Athena Project, AltaVista Firewall/Tunnel (VPN) Products. Dan has a BA in Mathematics from the College of the Holy Cross and a MS in Computer Science from Worcester Polytechnic Institute. Twitter: rhatdan Blog: danwalsh.livejournal.com Email: [masked]
