results.description:
Join the members of The NYC Political Forum (http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/) for another Dinner & Politics series -- this time it will be an evening filled with a chock-full of foreign affairs  topics.  We'll discuss the following three contentious matters that unfolded recently:

I. China:  President Xi Jinping's recent visit to the U.S., amid China's economic downturn and the devaluation of its currency.  More importantly, how this official State visit impacts the ever-increasingly complex nature of the U.S.-China relationship.

II. Iran: the latest developments in the Nuclear Deal.

III.  Vatican: the recent Papal visit and the Vatican's  historic role in its attempt to shape and influence the U.S. public policies.

PLUS, if time permits, we'll also discuss the latest military escalations in Syria.


---------------------------------------------------

How the RSVP works:

The RSVP window will open on Saturday,  October 3rd at noon -- it is managed this way for fairness.  The discussions are intended to be among a small group of approximately ten to twelve members.  In order to attend, your RSVP status must be a confirmed "YES" -- being on a wait list is not a confirmed "YES" RSVP.

---------------------------------------------------

We'll be gathering at a large table on the mezzanine level, as shown in the photo below.




.

results.description:
We're excited to announce a special evening with one of the world’s preeminent experts in the self-regulation of behavior change, Professor Gabriele Oettingen of the NYU Psychology Department and University of Hamburg. 

It seems like everywhere we turn, we’re inundated with the message to “Think Positive” - but research shows that positive thinking alone often falls short. Dr. Oettingen’s research has discovered the key for actualizing our goals, a process she coined as Mental Contrasting with Implementations and Intentions (MCII). It combines focusing both on the dream and obstacles, ultimately allowing for a realistic blueprint to achieve success. Dr. Oettingen has simplified the execution of WOOP [Wish, Outcome, Obstacle, Plan] a powerful technique to short and long-term goals. Examples of successful large-scale studies include smoking cessation, weight loss, improvement in academics, sustainment of fulfilling relationships, and effective business negotiations.

ABOUT THE EVENT

Our event will begin with Dr. Oettingen sharing key insights from her work followed by the application of the principles through audience participation and interaction. We encourage you to check out the free WOOP app or audio recordings, apply the process to a challenge you are encountering, and bring directed questions to the event.

This unique opportunity will take place live in New York City, with opportunities for members of other Habit Design chapters to join in virtually.

SCHEDULE:

6:30-7:00 PM (Eastern): Social mingling & networking

7:00-8:00 PM: Dr. Oettingen’s presentation and discussion / Q&A

8:00-8:30 PM: More social mingling & networking

Special thanks to our friends at Grand Central Tech for hosting!


ABOUT THE SPEAKER:

Gabriele Oettingen received her Ph.D. from the Ludwig Maximilian University in Munich and the Max Planck Institute for Behavioral Physiology in Seewiesen, Germany, and currently is a Professor of Psychology at New York University and the University of Hamburg. Her major contribution to the field is research on the perils of positive thinking and on Mental Contrasting, a self-regulation technique that is effective for mastering one’s daily life and long-term development. She is the author of Rethinking Positive Thinking: Inside the New Science of Motivation, as well as over 100 articles and book chapters about the future and the control of cognition, emotion, and behavior. Dr. Oettingen’s work is published in a wide range of journals spanning many fields of psychology, health, and medicine, and its applications have recently drawn interest from a variety of businesses and institutions. 

Find out more at: http://www.psych.nyu.edu/oettingen


NOTE: 

At-the-door registration is NOT available and only registrants will be admitted.

Unfortunately due to logistics beyond our control, transfers or partial refunds are not available.

results.description:
This night is going to be in a 100 Year old beautiful Peaceful Church. 

Its all about creating moments that matter. Indulging in a taste of pure pleasure, is the way of presenting that philosophy of Yoga and Chocolate. 

We believe that yoga, meaning union, is ultimately a Peaceful Journey. It is a journey that takes us through the physical body and beyond into the realms of pure consciousness. It is the union of the body-mind with the soul. We are going to make this journey as yummy and delicious, and as powerful and blissful as we possibly can, for you. 

That’s where chocolate comes in…

I hired the BEST in Ridgewood. Kilwin's

 Kilwins<a>https://www.</a>;kilwins.com/

Chocolate in its purest form), is a forgotten plant medicine – Cacao was known to the Ancient Mayans as a powerful  and potent healer. Perfect for deepening your yoga and meditation practice!


Chocolate is widely known as an aphrodisiac and this understanding of how it opens our hearts is by no means new. The Aztecs often spoke of Cacao as ‘yollotl, eztli’, meaning “heart, blood”. Western science reinforced this by giving it the scientific name Theobroma Cacao, which means “The food of the Gods” – and what else would the food of the Gods be but love? No wonder we give chocolate on St Valentines Day.

This Night We Will  Practice Chair Yoga- w Amy B - We will have a Chocolate and Wine Sampler included. 

Wine is an option - If you like

 All to Live Music

No yoga experience is necessary.
Easy to practice 
No special equipment or yoga clothes needed.
Learn breathing, focus, meditation and relaxation techniques. 

“I think it’s really normal for an entire day to go by with nothing happening that you could remember that day by,”  “I We will teach people — and I work with myself to do this too — to use the things you love most, in your everyday life , Your passions, to explore the moment. We will be embracing an exotic piece of chocolate as a ritual, Live Music and Yoga together  … these 3 basic things that people can relate to feel better in their day.


My mantra, is that every day in life, try to have one delicious moment, one beautiful moment, and one funny moment. If you keep that checklist, it’s an awesome way to Live to your life.”

Peace and Love 

Robert 

Only $19.00 pp 

Ladies and Ladies-Thanks for your RSVP  Please send payment in. PO box 184, Ridgewood, NJ 07451 

Thanks,  Robert 


or with paypal.com Send monies to [masked]

results.description:
Schedule: 


Pizza/beer at 6:30

Talk at 7 pm

Abstract:

With over 30 million tracks and 1.5 billion playlists in Spotify's growing catalog, recommendation systems play a key role in enhancing user experience on Spotify. This talk will explain how scalable and robust data pipelines for music recommendations are built at Spotify. We will deep dive into the batch approach by tracking the lifecycle from user clicks to music recommendations. We will also discuss how Spotify addresses the YOLO problem: "You Only Listen Once", to judge recommendations and the challenges arising from optimizing for user engagement.

Bio:

Vidhya is a data science engineer at Spotify NYC. She works on playlist recommendations and personalization in Spotify's music recommendations team.
results.name: Data Pipelines for Music Recommendations at Spotify

Irresistible Change – Gaining Confidence

An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

Imagine "YOU"More confident, Less stressed, Better focused

Imagine You Achieving Your Goal

Imagine You Living a Better Life

If you've got a desire to make that vision a reality, to attain the life, the body and goals you want, then you can join us for an information and experiential evening and start to Learn these skills NOW.

We'll explore some simple skills that you can practice to become more assured, more relaxed, more confident in different parts of your life.

And we'll do some group trance as well to help install even more change.

Come join us for a fun-filled evening.

===================================

Visit website to Learn More

===================================

=================================

CLICK HERE to Pay

$35 Regular Price

$25 Early Price (available until 3 days before event)

=================================

Train Your Brains: An Intro to Hypnosis+NLP

Description of Class:
This is a hands-on class for those interested learning/experiencing some of the basic hypnosis, NLP, trance and other transformational skills so they might help themselves &/or others.

Duration: 2 hours

What will you learn?

This is a hands-on class.  Every class is different and we will focus on different aspects of Hypnosis+NLP.  And we’ll give plenty of time to practice these skills.

Who is this class for?
This class is for anyone that is for anyone who is curious about hypnosis, NLP and changework and how they can impact their life or the lives of others.

Whats required for this class?
Nothing is required for the class.  Just bring your curiosity, a willingness to explore, to learn and be open to the possibility of becoming massively different in a really good way.

=================================

CLICK HERE to Pay

$35 Regular Price

$25 Early Price (available until 3 days before event)

About Joel

Joel Elfman is a Hypnotist, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) trainer with over 14 years of experience. He has taught NLP and Hypnosis in over 400+ Meetups for thousands of people.

Joel specializes in creating safe spaces for clients to generate lasting change. He helps to transform old problems into new positive habits, beliefs and ways of enjoying life. Areas of focus include losing weight, building confidence, reducing stress and more.

http://www.joelelfman.com

Visit my website for answers to Frequently Asked Questions about NLP & Hypnosis

*NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) is often called the study of subjective reality, how each individual uniquely experiences, processes and communicates with the world around them. Once an individual's patterns are modeled, the tools of NLP are highly effective in creating change.

<a href="http://www.joelelfman.com"></a>

Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers) 

After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold! 

Please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

Hope to see you there! happy folding!!

Due to the closing of Cosi at 23rd around 9pm. At this time this group will be meeting at Panera Breads near 28th and 29th, with a backup location meeting of Argo Tea near FIT. Panera closes at 10pm, and Argo closes at 11pm. 

Also I usually get there a bit earlier, so please look for paper folders, or at least the presence of paper. 

-Linda

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.

results.description:
Join us for an evening of intense usability testing with fellow startup companies. 

Think 'Speed Dating' for Product Feedback. Over the course of an hour and a half you'll meet with 5-6 other startups and take turns to give and get feedback on each other's ideas.

THE FORMAT: 

Bring your wireframes, sketches, or freshly-baked code - and arrive with one clear task you want the user to achieve.

For example, it could be navigating through your onboarding, posting an event, listing an item on your site, or taking and sharing a photo.

You'll then have 7 minutes to watch (and listen!) to another startup interact with your product, before the tables turn and you get to test their product out too.

This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com

I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
Many investor that we talk to are frightened to invest out-of-state, because they have an inherent mistrust (or maybe a bad experience) with property managers.

Property managers are your feet on the ground, and he success of the plan that you have for your property really depends on how effectively it’s managed. We view our property managers as PARTNERS, not EMPLOYEES.

Come and join us October 8th, where we’ll break down:

·  How to screen property management, and the three questions you MUST ask

·   How to select the right type of management for the right property


·  A case study of leveraging property management successfully

 I’m looking forward to seeing you in Westbury – make sure you grab your seat by clicking here

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

Due to a complication with location, we have had to reschedule the meetup.

The new meetup will be held in the same location as before

please note that we may be on the 7th or the 8th floor. so go to both floors until you find us

if you have any questions call or text me:

Anton[masked]

The meetup:

We are specifically focused on projects that need funding and people who have funds and are looking for deals.  Everyone is welcome to come, but investors and entrepreneurs are preferred. Based on past meetups, we have ran out of space and time before, so there will be a maximum of 10 people presenting. presenters are on a first come first serve basis. 

As usual the meetup is broken up in to 3 parts

Part 1 is meet and greet

Part 2 is deal presentations

Part 3 is mingle

Presentations will now be strictly limited to 5 minutes + 2 minutes Q&A

To pitch your deal. You can bring any supporting information including, PowerPoint, video, handouts, ect... If you need assistance setting up in advance please let me know 1-2 days in advance.

We have no restrictions on what kind of deals you want to present, anything goes.

If you are presenting or if you are an investor and want to bring a partner or an associate, you may bring up to 2 other people with you for a total of 3 people for the price of 1 attendee.

My email: [masked]

ps; as before I will gather all attendees information and email it to everyone at the end of the meetup.

results.description:
Come out to the October SingApplause! Session!  (November's session is the last session for the Fall season.)

Practice performing your songs at SingApplause!© This session gives you a chance to try out the music you’ve been working on in a safe, supportive and fun environment!

If you want try out a new song, brush up on an older one, present an original song or try out an entirely new style, SingApplause! is the place for you!

SingApplause! is simple, one person sings, everyone else applauds, and then the next person takes a turn, that’s it!

There’s no criticism, no coaching, no skills evaluation or any other negative commentary.  So whether you're a professional singer, amateur, wedding/event singer or songwriter - SingApplause! is for you!

If you are working on an aria, art song, spiritual, theater song, original song, jazz standard, whatever! - This session is for you!

We have a lot of fun in these sessions, so I hope you can make it and join in the fun!

Dr. Richard Duncan, Pianist (extraordinary pianist that can play just about any sheet music you give him!)

When: Thursday, October 8, 2015

Time: 6:45 – 9:00 PM
Cost: $15.00

Where: Yeoryia Studios
Othello Studio, 5th floor
2067 Broadway
(Between 71 - 72nd Streets)

*Please bring 3 - 5 songs that you would like to sing.

RSVP by Wednesday, October 7th.

All attendees sing! No auditors! Thanks.

And if you're coming right from work Vintage does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

Vintage has been serving the White Plains community for many years.

It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!


Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*


There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*
results.name: Trivia Quiz Night @ Vintage in White Plains

results.description:
Please join us to hang out, relax and make new friends.
We'll chat, grab some magazines, books, snacks and meet in the cafe area. A friendly game usually breaks out too.
This is a large store with a big used book section, a music section, and an upstairs lounging spot. There is also a very large parking lot.

***Please only RSVP "yes" if you are able to attend the event.

$1 fee to help cover Meetup costs. Please find the envelope upon your arrival. 

See you soon!

results.description:

Bring water and some dark chocolate for an energy boost. The classes are 2 hours long, you are going to need it!

results.description:
This is a rules light FATE-based game based on the pulp hero novels of the 20/30's. It's inspired by pulp characters such as Doc Savage and the Shadow.


Below is a link to a SRD for Spirit Of the Century if you'd like to get a sense of the rules.

http://www.faterpg.com/dl/sotc-srd.html

There are further details in the Campaign Recruiting message board.
results.name: Spirit Of The Century (pulp RPG)

results.description:
Perfect for anyone interested in Italian, wines and language! Let's explore the grapes & regions of Italy with a wine expert.

Location is 20 mins from midtown Manhattan by train. 9th street station on the RFG lines.

Just 2 stops away from Atlantic Ave Barclays Center & RDQN2345 & LIRR

It is $15 to attend; everyone will receive a $10 gift card for use in the store, meaning you can leave that same night with a bottle of wine!

-SERIOUS SIGNUPS ONLY! We need to know how many will be attending that night! We have a 3 strikes rule!
-Write what languages you speak and what you would like to practice so you make language partners!
results.name: ITALIAN WINES Tasting & conversation! Take-home bottle included!

venue.name: Namaste Bookshop's Namaste Healing Center Floor

results.description:
Free Event with Andrew Vidich

Meditation: And the After Life Journey of the Soul

​Based on the Book Spark of the Divine by Sant Rajinder Singh Ji Maharaj

All great religious and spiritual traditions have laid great emphasis on the meaning and understanding of death and the afterlife.  In this workshop we will explore the many faceted faces of death and the after life journey of the soul viewed through the lens of the great Masters of spirituality .  

Who we are, where do we go and what is the nature of the soul’s existence after death will form the basis of our inquiry. No matter who we are each of us will have to face the moment of death. By understanding

what is the soul, what dies and what lies beyond this physical existence each of us can learn more fully how to live in the present moment. Death may be the single greatest teacher we all encounter in our lives. 

Join us for an interactive evening lecture and discussion followed by a demonstration of a simple but profound method of meditation to begin our own inner journey into the after life .
results.name: FREE EVENT WITH ANDREW VIDICH MEDITATION: AND THE AFTER LIFE JOURNEY OF THE SOUL

group.name: Namaste Bookshop & Healing Center Meetup Group NYC

results.description:
The Bisexual Women's Group will meet in the front lobby at 7 pm to see photography of LGBT people in South Africa - as well as Judy Chicago's "The Dinner Party".

This event is intended for WOMEN ONLY. Trans-inclusive.

The Brooklyn Museum of Art
Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art, 4th Floor

Zanele Muholi meshes her work in photography, video, and installation with human rights activism to create visibility for the black lesbian and transgender communities of South Africa. Zanele Muholi: Isibonelo/Evidence is the most comprehensive museum presentation to date of Muholi’s works and features several of the artist’s ongoing projects about lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and intersex (LGBTI) communities, both in her home country and abroad.
https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/zanele_muholi

On the same floor, is Judy Chicago's "Dinner Party", a feminist classic.

The Brooklyn Museum is open on Thursdays from 11 am–10 pm. It is always pay what you wish. The suggested admission for adults is $16 - but you can pay less.

Take the #2 or #3 subway to the Eastern Parkway stop.
results.name: Zanele Muholi & Feminist Art at the Brooklyn Museum

results.description:
Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble

Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. 

SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer
results.name: Join our Christmas Blues Rock ensemble!

A collaborative effort by Peatix and Komeeda, Chef Showdown aims to provide a platform for new and ambitious chefs to showcase their creative talents via a social and interactive evening. The event will bring together three innovative chefs and food lovers (a.k.a. you!), for a night of bites, drinks and conversation.


Competition Details

Three chefs will each be creating two bite-sized appetizers reflecting their creative abilities. You, the audience, will taste, critique and judge each bite based on creativity, presentation and taste. The winner will be crowned the Showdown Champion!


Event Details

Ticket Pricing: $25 Online I $30 Cash At Door.

Ticket includes all six bites, beer/wine, welcome hors d'oeuvres and the opportunity to vote for the Chef Showdown #3 winner.

TICKETS CAN BE PURCHASED AT : http://chefshowdown3.peatix.com

Check out photos from our last event on Facebook

All sales are final and non-refundable.

results.description:
The Sound Mind gathering explores the vibrational and sound healing for personal meditation, soul expansion, as well as physical well-being. 

When we learn to use our breath and voice for toning, chanting, and psychosomatic actualization, we become powerful healers. The gifts we were born to share come to fruition if we but dare to explore, expand, AND express our vibrational state. You can tune your Soul-Body to higher dimensions and progress your visionary abilities following the scale of sound and color - starting where you are and who you are at the present moment and then climbing up.

The starting point is like looking at a hiking map with a little red circle that says 'you are here' and all the possible trails ahead and then you take off - transcendence path is a process that is anchored in the body. No matter how natural and sacred, there is no vine, shroom, or chemical that will take you to the next level of spiritual consciousness. You can change your state and catch a glimpse of your transcendent vision, yes, right here within your Soul-Body.

Sound Mind is about a durable and steady progress into who you were meant to become in this amazing moment of opportunity that we call a human life. It goes fast, so why not …make a sound?
results.name: Sound Mind - Heal Your Life with Sounding, Toning, and Chanting

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
This workshop presented in cooperation with Deutsches Haus NYU will provide parents with information on typical speech and language developmental milestones for toddlers and pre-schoolers with an emphasis on the multilingual child.

Parents will learn how to best support their child learning two or more languages simultaneously and look for red flags in their child’s speech and language development.

The workshop will conclude with practical tips and exercises to elicit speech and language through play. Parents get guidelines and best practices on how to make sure their children can take full advantage of the lifelong gift of multi-lingualism.

Speaker: Andrea Pieper

Andrea is a licensed speech therapist and the Language Program Deputy Coordinator at Deutsches Haus NYU.

THIS SEMINAR IS HELD IN GERMAN

Fee: $39 per person

REGISTER HERE
results.name: Seminar: Toddler Talk for Multilingual Children

venue.name: The New York Academy of Sciences

results.description:
The New York Academy of Sciences, as part of their "From Knowledge to Wisdom" series, will be giving a panel discussion "The Paradox of Pleasure" on the science of happiness.

Link: Register with NYAS here.


Tickets are $5 for members, $15 for non-members, $7 for non-member students.

The pursuit of happiness is enshrined in the founding document of our nation as a fundamental and inalienable right. Yet nowhere is the method of this pursuit clearly defined. What, exactly, does it mean to be happy, and how can such happiness be sustained over the long-term? Can happiness be accurately gauged or measured? How does the paradoxical relationship between happiness and pleasure shape our quest to lead the good life? And what does modern science have to tell us about this universal yet elusive pursuit? Attorney and author Kim Azzarelli, historian Darrin McMahon, and social psychologist Barry Schwartz join forces to share their research and insight on happiness, pleasure, and the coveted good life.

*Reception to follow.

Featuring Kim Azzarelli, JD

Adjunct Professor at Cornell Law School and Founding Partner of Seneca Point Global
Author of "Fast Forward: How Women Can Achieve Power and Purpose"

Darrin McMahon, PhD

Professor of History at Dartmouth College
Author of "Happiness: A History"

Barry Schwartz, PhD

Dorwin Cartwright Professor of Social Theory and Social Action at Swarthmore College
Author of "The Paradox of Choice: Why More is Less"
results.how_to_find_us: There is usually wine and cheese after the lecture.  I look like my picture.
results.name: NYAS: The New Science of Happiness

results.description:
Greetings Heroes! 

It is with great pride that we can announce that eSports Hero andNebulous Gaming NYC have officially partnered in hopes that together we can provide the gamers of New York City with a strong community and a new place to call home. Located in Manhattan's Lower East Side, we are going to turn the 2,500+ square foot private venue into the hub for all gaming and eSports events on the East Coast.

With that said, bring out your laptop, phone, or tablet every Thursday, and join us for an evening of food, friends, and Hearthstone as we celebrate the re-launch of Nebulous Gaming NYC and our Weekly Fireside Program.

---

These Hearthstone Fireside Tournaments are to be hosted weekly in a completely private venue. Similar to how Magic the Gathering has coined "Friday Night Magic", we want to make "Thursday Night Firesides" something that will  always be available to you guys. We are taking the traditional Fireside format up a notch and you can expect that every week there will be at least one of the following taking place: (1) Deckbuilding Competition, (2) Challenge Stone Tournament, (3) Double Team Tournament (2v2), (4) Conquest Tournament.

As an official part of the Blizzard FSG program we will also do our very best to provide our Hearthstone community with Card Packs, and anything Swag Blizzard passes on to us.

$6 is the Grand Opening Price Discount and the cover will be collected at the door. Once you pay, feel free to stay as late as your heart desires (or at least until close which is usually around midnight). There are cool funky bodegas right around nebs where you can grab snacks / sandwiches throughout the night.

Nebulous Gaming NYC: 

https://www.facebook.com/NebulousGaming

---

The new Nebulous Venue is beautiful and very chill. The WiFi is blazing fast and there are power outlets for everyone. There will be Pizza, board games, Digital Darts, and snacks / beverages available for purchase on site. 

*Pro Gamers / VIPs will be in attendance. *

Pre-Register via meetup. 150 Person Capacity.

---

Leadership Opportunities:

We need someone that is passionate about Hearthstone and is willing to help spearhead this weekly Fireside as a Community Leader. If you are interested in helping us run events in NYC, please reach out. Forward your resume to [masked]

---

For More information about our partners check out the following links:

Nebulous Gaming NYC: https://www.facebook.com/NebulousGaming

Hearthlytics: 

http://hearthlytics.com

Blizzard FSG: 

http://us.battle.net/hearthstone/en/fireside-gatherings 

2ARC Gaming:

http://2arcgaming.com/ 

Vicious Syndicate: 

http://www.vicioushs.cards/
results.name: Weekly Hearthstone Fireside Tournament

results.description:
Its open board game night! Grab some friends and your favorite board game and head on over to the Highlander location in Boonton to have some fun.  Don't have a game, or interested in playing a new one?  We've got an extensive demo library open to everyone so feel free to pick whichever game strikes your fancy, grab a group, and play. 


Additionally there will be a featured demo of a different game each week, I'll be updating this meetup each week so you guys know what we've got. 


Other than that feel free to use this meetup as a way to organize your own games for Thursday nights, we've got space for everyone and plenty of people already show up so picking up a group should be no problem at all.  Hope to see you there!
results.name: Open Board Game Night

results.description: This group will meet every Thursday night at 7:00 pm at The Immaculate Conception Church. We celebrate a healing Mass followed by adoration of The Blessed Sacrament. We pray for each other and as a group we pray for our spiritual growth and holiness. We forgive, we love, we embrace, we pray and we don't judge. Our goal is keeping the fire of our Lord blazing in our souls and make sure we are helping each other on the road to Heaven. Spiritual talks will be held from time to time. Come, let us pray together We need each other. Heaven is the house of God's family, be one. Love you all.
results.name: Let us Meetup...

PLEASE RSVP RESPONSIBLY.

This restaurant has both Chinese and Japanese cuisine .  You have the option of paying per item that you would like to order if you are not interested in the all you can eat offer (check out the full menu here) 

.... OR ..... 

you can get ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI AND SASHIMI and then some!!  The All You Can Eat offer is only $22.95 and there is a ton to choose from, as you can see at this All You Can Eat menu link.  

The website will show that the all you can eat sushi is $19.95, but that does not include the extra items.  JUST sushi.  Yes, I know, a bit misleading, but I am making sure you know the real deal now, so no complaints can be made! ;-)


The place is very nice, and the food is VERY fresh!!

Each person will be responsible for their own portion of the bill, and we will use the "x1.3 Rule" to calculate tax and tip.

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

venue.name: Prospect Park Entrance at Grand Army Plaza

results.description:
We are hosting weekly "track" workouts at Prospect Park every Thursday evening. The workouts will be identical to the East River Park Track workout of the week, which will be posted at least 24 hours beforehand.

Although there is no track at Prospect Park, we'll find the flattest part of the park to do the scheduled workout.

All paces are welcome. Please comment in Talk about this Meetup if you have any questions!

results.description:
Questions to be discussed include:

1. Why does God permit so much evil in the world?
2. What does mankind's future look like, as per the Bible?
3. Are science and faith mutually exclusive? Could they be reconciled with each other?
4. What happens when a man dies?
5. Can the Bible be harmonized from Genesis to Revelation? Does it contradict itself anywhere?
6. What is the Kingdom of Heaven?
7. Why is it taking so long to come? Hasn't it been 2000 years since Jesus?
results.name: Thursday Evening Bible Study (Manhattan)

results.description:
Bi women will meet in the front lobby at 7 pm to see photography of LGBT people in South Africa - as well as Judy Chicago's "The Dinner Party".

The Brooklyn Museum of Art
Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art, 4th Floor

Zanele Muholi meshes her work in photography, video, and installation with human rights activism to create visibility for the black lesbian and transgender communities of South Africa. Zanele Muholi: Isibonelo/Evidence is the most comprehensive museum presentation to date of Muholi’s works and features several of the artist’s ongoing projects about lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and intersex (LGBTI) communities, both in her home country and abroad.
https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/zanele_muholi

On the same floor, is Judy Chicago's "Dinner Party", a feminist classic.

The Brooklyn Museum is open on Thursdays from 11 am–10 pm. It is always pay what you wish. The suggested admission for adults is $16 - but you can pay less.

Take the #2 or #3 subway to the Eastern Parkway stop.
results.name: Zanele Muholi & Feminist Art at the Brooklyn Museum

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
